loans.name: Antonietta

texts.en:
Antonietta is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Antonietta is 44 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Antonietta has a selling of feed business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of feeds to sell.

Antonietta has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Antonietta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of feed to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah works hard to support her family. Sarah is married and has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines.
Sarah requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of frozen foods to sell.
Sarah has been in this business for 10 years now.
In the future, Sarah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 45 years old and married with three children.
Nelly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.
Nelly has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.
Nelly aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Felix's Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 40 years old. He would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy carpets and renovate his workplace .

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Renalyn works hard to support her family.
She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs. Renalyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.
Renalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Zuma Group

texts.en:
Maclaud, who is in his mid 50s, is married with three children who are still in school.  He has been running a bar and a restaurant business for nine years now.  He works from 5 am until midnight daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be Maclaud's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to expand and repair his restaurant/bar, which used to be small but is now big and attractive. He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He is doing fine with the loan.  He used the profit to pay school fees, build his house and cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy beer, wine, spirits, soda, juice and water.  He dreams of improving his lifestyle.

Maclaud will share this loan with his four-member loan group "Zuma". The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy beer, wine, spirits, soda, juice and water.

loans.name: Huriyat

texts.en: Huriyat is a young and purposeful woman. She is not married and lives with her parents. Huriyat is 20 years old. She has always wanted to organize her own business. Huriyat took part in the course ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women's organization and learned a lot of new and useful information. Huriyat is going to start a sewing business so she can sew national women's dresses. Huriyat is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine for organizing this business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for organizing a new business

loans.name: Andrea Victoria

texts.es: Andrea es casada  tiene 2 hijos  de 5 y 3 años el mayor asiste a la escuela, Andrea se dedica desde hace 9 años a la venta ambulante de frutas y hortalizas, su esposo es ayudante de un chofer de un camión,  Andrea juntamente con su pequeña hija  se pasean por las calles aspirando vender algo de sus productos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería en frutas y hortalizas, la aspiración de esta señora trabajadora es ponerse un local de frutas y también vender en el mercado y en lo posible comprar una pequeña casa ya que actualmente vive arrendando.
texts.en:
Andrea is married and has 2 children of 5 and 3 years; the oldest is in school. Since she was 9 years old, Andrea has worked as a street vendor selling fruits and vegetables. Her husband is an assistant to a truck driver. Together with her young daughter, Andrea goes around the streets hoping to sell something from her produce.

She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of fruit and vegetable goods. This hardworking woman's dream is to open a business for fruit, to sell in the market, and, if possible, to buy a small house, as she is currently renting.

loans.use: to purchase fruit.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom is 19 years old. She is not married and lives with her mother. They live poorly because her mother has been busy with animal husbandry and makes just a little income. Dilorom began her own business by baking and selling rolls, biscuits, etc. two month ago. She bakes in her house and sells in a local market. Her mother helps her manage her new business. Dilorom needs a new oven because her present oven is old. Dilorom is asking for a loan of 500 Somoni to buy an oven to increase the working capital of new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an oven for her new business

loans.name: Verginith

texts.en:
Verginith is 37 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Verginith is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fee and vitamins for her pigs.

Verginith has been in the pig fattening business for two years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es:
El señor José es un orgullo agricultor de 71 años de vida que ha dedicado su alma y ser al campo, a entregar sus servicios al bien de la comunidad, actividad que aprendió de sus padres y que ha ejercido hace más de 50 años, por el legado que dejo su familia y su amplio recorrido ha logrado fidelizar un grupo de clientes a los que le comercializa sus productos con los que logra mantener su familia. Debido a los extremos cambios climáticos que han ocurrido en la zona ha perdido mucho cultivo, y aunque sabe que son pérdidas que comúnmente pasan a los agricultores tiene muy claro que esta microempresa es la única fuente de dinero que tiene y que ya por su avanzada edad no puede conseguir otro empleo. Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agropecuarios, semillas, fertilizantes para aumentar su producción y mantener sus cultivos que es su único anhelo, ya que José tiene muy claro que será lo único que lo acompañe en lo que le falta de vida  

Nota: el credito aparece ha nombre de Ana ya el señor José es de muy avanzada edad y no lo podia tomar a su nombre
texts.en:
José is a proud farmer of 71 years who has dedicated his soul and body to the fields and to offering his services for the well-being of the community. He learned this work from his parents and has been doing it for more than 50 years. Due to the legacy that his family left and their extensive lands, he was able to earn the loyalty of a group of customers who sell his produce, with which he is able to support his family.

Owing to the extreme climate changes that have occurred in the area, he has lost a lot of crops. Although he knows that they are lost and that this often happens to farmers, it is very clear to him that this micro-enterprise is the only source of money that he has, and due to his advanced age, he is not able to find other work.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of farming supplies, seeds, and fertilizers in order to increase his production and support his crops. This is his only desire, since José is sure that this will be the only thing that will be with him when life is lacking.

Note: The loan appears under Ana's name, as José is very elderly and it was not possible to use his name.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies, fertilizers, and seeds to support his crop over time, as this is all that he has left.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 55 years old and married with four children. 

Visitacion is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Visitacion requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Visitacion has been raising livestock for six years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Visitacion would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Dúo Pascuas Group

texts.es: Dúo Pascuas, integrado por doña Anabella,es casada y tiene un hijo quien ya estudia, su esposo trabaja como chofer de una finca, doña Anabella tiene una librería surtida pues es la única que está en el sector, y en buen punto cerca de la escuela, también vende cosméticos por catalogo pues también es la única que vende y sale a ofrecer sus productos a caseríos cercanos,esta feliz por los logros que ha tenido, su mama vive con ella, ahora desea poner venta de ropa para niños y blusas o suéteres para dama es por esa razon que esta solicitando este credito, y asi seguir ayudando económicamente a su familia,
texts.en:
Anabella is a member of Dúo Pascuas. She is married and has a son who is still at school. Her husband works as a driver on an estate.  Anabella has a well stocked stationery shop, which is the only one in her area and it is in a good location near the school. She also sells cosmetics from catalogues and, again, she is the only one doing this. She goes out selling her products in the nearby hamlets. 

She is happy with what she has achieved. Her mum lives with her. She now wants to start out selling clothing for children and blouses and sweaters for women. This is the reason why she is asking for this loan, so she can continue to support her family financially,

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Melona

texts.en:
As a married parent of thirteen children, Melona works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Melona is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits like bananas, mangoes, etc. to sell in her fruit stall.

Melona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business and secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more fruits like bananas, mangoes, etc. to sell in her fruit stall

loans.name: Hira

texts.en:
Hira is 28 years old and married with three children.

Hira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

She has borrowed and paid back 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Hira aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Cooproriz Mirayi G5 Group

texts.en:
Vincent is 39 years old. He is married with four children and they all go to school. He would like to use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Segundo Rafael

texts.es: Rafael es un señor divorciado, tiene 3 hijos de 7, 14 y 16 años, de los cuales las 2 mayores viven con él y el menor vive con la mamá, Rafael es colombiano y por este motivo otras instituciones le han negado crédito, Rafael está muy agradecido con Fodemi por haberle apoyado con el crédito anterior  y dice que es muy puntual en sus pagos,    con el nuevo crédito va a comprar una vaca para incrementarla en su negocio, este señor también se dedica a trabajar en una planta florícola para poder cubrir los gastos de educación, alimentación  y salud de las hijas que viven con él y también de su hijo menor, comenta Rafael que vive ya 5 años en el Ecuador y que puede apreciar que es un país tranquilo para vivir.
texts.en:
Rafael is divorced and has 3 children aged 7,14 and 16 years. The two older ones, both daughters, live with him and the youngest lives with his mum. Rafael is Colombian and because of this, he has been refused credit by other institutions. Rafael is very grateful to Fodemi for having helped him with a previous loan and says he is very punctual with his payments. 

With the new loan he is going to buy a cow to expand his business. He also works in a flower-growing business in order to cover the cost of education, food and healthcare for his daughters who live with him and also for his youngest son. Rafael says he has lived in Ecuador for 5 years and he appreciates the fact that it is a peaceful country to live in.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle is 37 years old and married. She has five children, three of whom are currently in school.

Rochelle is in the agricultural business, raising goats in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Rochelle has been raising goats for 8 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to feed and  look after her coffee crops.

loans.name: Mwangaza Group

texts.en:
Joyce is in her early 40s and married. She has five children, two sons and three daughters, and only two are still at school. She has been running a restaurant for four years now. She works from 6am to 10pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Joyce's 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more food and bites in the restaurant, and has paid back all her loans successfully. She was very happy with the loans, and she used the profit to pay school fees and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her restaurant inventory so she can serve more people. She dreams of starting another business as well.

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group "Mwangaza", consisting of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her restaurant inventory so she can serve more people.

loans.name: Sulhiya

texts.ru: Сулхия жительница города Турсунзаде в возрасте 39 лет. В данный момент она не замужем, имеет двух детей. Вместе с ней живет ее мать. Сулхия по профессии учительница и уже 19 лет работает в местной школе. Параллельно Сулхия еще и занимается растениеводством. Она на приусадебном участке земли выращивает огородные и бахчевые культуры. Для того, чтобы провести весенний посев, Сулхие не хватает собственных средств. В связи с этим Сулхия обратилась за кредитом, на сумму которого собирается приобрести семена бахчевых культур и минеральные удобрения. Она действительно нуждается в заемных средствах, чтобы продолжить свою земледельческую деятельность.
texts.en: Sulhiya is a 39-year-old resident of Tursun-zoda.  She is currently single, has two children and has her mother living with her.  Sulhiya is a teacher and has been working for 19 years in a local school.  She's also a crop farmer on the side and is growing garden vegetables and melons on a plot of land adjoined to her house.  She lacks the money to pay for her spring plantings and is seeking a loan to buy seeds for melons, as well as mineral fertilizers.  She is counting on the money from this loan to be able to start farming again.

loans.use: buy seeds for melons and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pans, plates, buckets, etc. for her business.

loans.use: to increase his purchase of summer collection clothes and renovate his workplace.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, a hair dryer, generator,  air conditioner and chair

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, meat, charcoal, vita, etc. for her business

loans.name: Nyabange Grp Msm Group

texts.en:
Makongu, who is in his late 40s, is married with nine children--five boys and four girls--who are still in school. He has been running two projects, a food cafe and a small retail shop, for the past 15 years. He opens at 6 a.m. and closes at 3 p.m. daily, and he is able to make a good monthly profit.  
This will be Makongu's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to increase his shop inventory. He dreams of expanding his shop and having broiler chicken.
Makongu will share this loan with his loan group Nyabange, which has eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his shop inventory.

loans.name: Mahliyo

texts.en: Mahliyo is a smart and hardworking woman. She is 19 years old. One month ago, Mahliyo started her sewing business. During some years, Mahliyo learnt sewing from a sewer who was a good master of sewing. Now, Mahliyo has enough experience to begin her sewing business. She has started to sew national woman dresses. She provides her sewing services in her house. Mahliyo needs a new sewing machine. She is asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine for increasing the working capital of her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy sewing machine for increasing the working capital of her new business

loans.use: to buy more rice oil, soap, and other items for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, beer, and cold water

loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and generator.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en: Annabella is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Annabella is 39 years old and has two children who are in school. Annabella has a fishing business in the Philippines. Annabella has requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business. Annabella has been in this business for 6 years. Annabella would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dinah is 30 years old and has two children who are in school. Dinah has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Dinah has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Dinah has been in this business for the past 5 years. In the future, Dinah would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Victory Group

texts.en:
Eliza is a mother of three school aged children. She is in her late 30s. She has had a business selling fruits and vegetables for two years. She opens her business from 6:30 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. every working day, and she is able to make a good monthly profit. 
This is her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy fruits and vegetables to resell. Eliza dreams of expanding her business portfolio by introducing other businesses, such as clothes and motorcycles. She will share this loan with her loan group Victory, which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 49 years old and married with two children. Teresita is in the agricultural business of raising goats in the Philippines. Teresita has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her goats. Teresita has been raising goats for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her goats

Jean Nepomuscene is 41 years old. He would like to use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming business, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. Jean Nepomuscene holds a paper, as a sign of differentiating him from other group members. In the picture, the lady with a yellow cloth has came up with his three sons and they posed a photo with the whole group. Those three sons are on standing on the last row from the right.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 52 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Vilma works very hard to provide for them. Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store. Vilma has been in this business for 4 years now, and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sanitary pads, dried fish, vinegar, salt, seasonings etc. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en: Estelita works hard to support her family. Estelita is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Estelita has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business. Estelita has been in this business for 7 years now. In the future, Estelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

texts.en: Leopolda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leopolda is 57 years old and has one child who is still in school. Leopolda has a candle vending business in the Philippines. Leopolda has requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of candle to sell to her customers. Leopolda has been in this business for the past 5 years. Leopolda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of candle to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en: Ma. Teresa works hard to support her family. Ma. Teresa is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma. Teresa has requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing nets, wood, bamboo etc for her business. Ma. Teresa has been in this business for 6 years now. Ma. Teresa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing nets, wood, bamboo etc for her business

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nena is 39 years old and has one child, who is currently in school. Nena has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Nena has requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers. Nena has been in this business for 35 years now. In the future, Nena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.use: to buy additional fish for her business.

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en: Angelie is 27 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Angelie works very hard to provide for them. Angelie runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store. Angelie has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cooking oil, cereals, chocolate drinks, sugar, candies, canned goods etc. In the future, Angelie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Hermigilda

texts.en: Hermigilda is 43 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Hermigilda is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Hermigilda has been involved in the pig fattening business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon products. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Zoyla

texts.es: Tiene 43 años de edad, está casada con dos hijos, que se encuentran cursando su carrera universitaria en una universidad del Municipio de Rosita. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal es guirisero. Ella trabaja atendiendo en una miscelánea de una tía, devengando un salario mensual aproximado de C$ 4,000 Desde hace aproximadamente 11 años habita en una casa de madera y tambo. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar materiales para cambiar la madera de su pequeña vivienda y mejorar el piso: 80 tablas de madera cepillada, clavos, zinc, madera rustica y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de sus hijos y familia en general. Quiere acondicionar también su casa con un inodoro, construir una  fosa séptica, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina en regular estado. También anhela con tener su propio negocio en el mercado.
texts.en:
She is 43 years old, married with two children, who are doing their university studies at a university in the Rosita municipality. Her husband works casually searching for gold.

She works in the small corner store of her aunt, earning a monthly salary of approximately C$4,000. For approximately the last 11 years she has been living in a house made of wood and metal barrels. With the aim of improving her dwelling, she is asking for her first loan to buy materials to change the wood of her small home and improving the flooring: 80 planks of wood, nails, zinc, untreated wood and to cover the costs of manual labor.

Her dream is to have a secure home, with the basic conditions of comfort for her children and her family in general. She wants to furnish her home with a lavatory and build a septic tank, as she currently has a regular latrine. She also longs to have her own business in the market.

loans.use: to buy materials to change the wood of her small dwelling and improve the floor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, rice, oil, onions and toothpaste for her business.

loans.name: Jose Libardo

texts.es: Jose es un señor colombiano que vive en Ecuador desde hace 3 años, comenta que en Ecuador tiene una vida más tranquila y sobre todo que hay donde trabajar , dice que en  Colombia hay mucha gente armada y es muy peligroso andar por las calles debido a la delincuencia,  Jose vive con su esposa y tiene 3 hijos que todos ya son mayores de edad, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono a fungicidas para cuidar sus cultivos, Jose aspira mejorar su negocio y en lo posible comprar una casa y vivir hasta el final en Ecuador.
texts.en: Jose is a Columbian who has lived in Ecuador for three years. He says that in Ecuador he has a quieter life, and above all that there are places to work; he says that in Columbia there are lots of armed people and that it's very dangerous to walk through the streets because of crime. Jose lives with his wife and they have three children, who are all of age now. He is going to invest the loan in buying compost and fungicides to care for his crops. Jose aspires to improve his business and, if possible, to buy a house and live in Ecuador for the rest of his life.

loans.use: to buy compost and fungicides

loans.name: Carlos Alvaro

texts.es: Carlos es un señor colombiano que vive un año en Ecuador con su esposa y su hijo de 5 años  que asiste a la escuela, Carlos tiene 10 años de experiencia en el cultivo de papas y un año que él se dedica a sembrar  este producto,  su esposa trabaja en una tienda,  el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para ponerles a sus plantas y que den buena producción, Carlos aspira tener buenas cosechas y con estos ingresos comprar una casa ya que actualmente vive arrendando, Carlos dice que le gustaría vivir para siempre en Ecuador ya que es un país tranquilo y no existe mucho peligro de la guerrilla como en Colombia,  Dice Carlos que la guerrilla llega a cualquier hogar y les piden que les den algo de sus bienes y que si se rehúsan a hacerlo les hacen daño a sus familiares dice que esta realidad se vive en Colombia.
texts.en:
Carlos is Colombian, but has been living in Ecuador for a year, together with his wife and his five-year-old son, who goes to school. Carlos has a ten-year experience growing potatoes and has been doing so during the last year, while his wife is a clerk.

Carlos will use this loan to buy compost to improve the production of his plantations. Carlos hopes to have good harvests and buy a house with the profits, since he lives now in a rented one.

Carlos says that he would like to stay forever in Ecuador, because it is a peaceful country and there are no threats from guerrilla groups as in Colombia. Carlos says that these groups can come to any home and ask people to give them some of their belongings. If they refuse, they hurt their relatives. He says that this is Colombia’s reality.

loans.use: to buy compost for his potato plantations.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 36 years old and married with two children.

Sylvia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like soft drinks, canned goods, bread, sugar, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Sylvia has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling gasoline.

Sylvia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like soft drinks, canned goods, bread, sugar, cooking oil, etc. to sell

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money to expand her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

Clemencia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a video gaming machine rental business in the Philippines. Clemencia has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables and food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her video gaming machine and payment for electric bills.

Clemencia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her video gaming machine and to pay electric bills.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Felomina is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Felomina has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Florita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, meat, spices, vegetables, noodles, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Agnes

Catherine has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Catherine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

Nila has requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her food production business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers for her business buying and selling used clothing. Rosa has been in this business for 3 years, and she earns more income from a general store.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 38 years old and has four children. Rosalina is married and has four children who are in school.

Rosalina is in an agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feeds and other supplies for her business.  Rosalina has been raising livestock for 3 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 60 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rufina has a business raising pigs in the Philippines, and she requested an 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rufina has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Rufina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Roselia

texts.en:
Roselia is 31 years old and has two children. Roselia is married and has two children who are in school.

Roselia is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Roselia has been in pig fattening for 2 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Roselia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.name: Snookey

texts.en:
Snookey works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Snookey requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.  Snookey has been in this business for 2 years now.

Snookey would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell. She has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, hair conditioner and coffee. 

Vivian would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries for her store, like canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, hair conditioner and coffee.

loans.name: Lolita

Lolita has been in this business for 20 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Antonieta has been in this business for three years. In the future, Antonieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Julita has been in this business for six years now. She would like to build and expand it so that she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar and seasonings for her bakery

loans.name: Julita

Julita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like a fish box and fishing net for her business.

Julita has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Julita would like to save money to expand her business.

Carmen has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Carmen has been in this business for six years now.

Carmen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: Georgina de 65 años de edad,  habita con su cónyuge en el suroccidente d e la ciudad; ella es madre de 2 hijos adultos y tiene bar familiar y  un restaurante desde hace 15 años,  cuando empezó a vender almuerzos a los empleados de negocios y a los de las construcciones en la vía circunvalar. Hoy los productos más importantes en su restaurante son los desayunos y los almuerzos corrientes, los cuales ofrece puerta a puerta y sobre los pedidos en las construcciones. Su negocio le deja un margen del 50% de la inversión, por eso está siempre dispuesta a trabajar persistentemente de lunes a viernes,  desde las 6 de la tarde a las 4 de la tarde, comprando sus insumos en el mercado, que es el lugar donde le resultan mas económicos y en graneros que le ofrecen buenos precios. Su meta es lograr hacer crecer su negocio y ofrecer mejor su servicio  de alimentación, para prosperar cada día más. Su mayor desafío es lograr la sostenibilidad de él,  para lograr responder a los pagos de sus obligaciones. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara ranchos y abarrotes, ampliando así su oferta alimentaria en su restaurante en función de lograr metas de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Georgina is a 65-year old woman who lives with his husband in the Southwest side of the city. She has two adult children and has owned a family bar and a restaurant for 15 years, when she started to sell lunches to business employees and construction workers. Her most important products today at her restaurant are breakfasts and regular lunches, which she offers door to door and on request from construction sites. Her business leaves a 50% margin, which is why she is always ready to work non-stop from Monday to Friday, 6am to 4pm. She buys ingredients in the market and in barns, where she founds better prices. 

Her goal is to expand her business and to offer a better food service, so that she can improve every day. Her biggest challenge is to make it sustainable and to be able to meet its financial obligations. She is currently using a loan from Kiva, her first one through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which will be invested in buying communal meals and groceries to increase her offer and reach her goal of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy communal meals and groceries.

loans.name: Aura Elisa

texts.es: Aura se dedica a la ganadería desde hace 40 años, ella vive con su esposo y con 3 de sus 7 hijos  y con  3 nietos,  tiene un hijo que está en el colegio y otro que asiste a  la universidad,  su esposo se dedica a la carpintería,  el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para incrementar  su negocio,  Aura aspira incrementar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos  y de esta manera pagar el costo de la educación de sus hijos y sobre todo la tesis de su hija que es el ultima paso para que se convierta en toda una profesional.
texts.en:
Aura has been working with livestock for 40 years.  She lives with her husband, three of her seven children, and three grandchildren.  She has a child who goes to high school and another who goes to the university.  Her husband is a carpenter.

She will use the loan to buy a cow to expand her business.  Aura wishes to expand her business in order to improve her income.  This way she will pay her children’s educational costs.  She especially wants to pay for her daughter’s thesis, which is the last step to her becoming a complete professional.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is a 32-year-old married woman with three children currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and equipment for fishing.

Lucita has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and equipment for fishing

loans.name: Silvia Narciza

texts.es: Silvia es madre de 3 hijos que asisten a la escuela, ella está separada de su esposo porque la maltrataba y no le daba dinero para la mantención de  para sus hijos, Silvia trabaja con un vecino ya que el elabora las prendas de vestir y maleta y Silvia las vende, ella es una madre muy responsable con su trabajo y sus hijos que para que le alcance a darles la alimentación, educación y vestimenta  a sus hijos ella también trabaja en un restaurante, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería en ropa para luego venderla, su ella está segura que   con el crédito de Fodemi y con el empeño que le pone en su negocio ella va a comprar una pequeña casa para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Silvia is mother of 3 children, who attend school. She is separated from his husband, who abused her and did not give her money to support their kids. Silvia works with a neighbor, selling the clothing items and suitcases that he makes. Silvia is a very responsible mother with her job and her children. She also works in a restaurant to earn what she needs to provide for them in terms of food, education and clothing. 

She will use the loan to buy clothes to resell. She is confident that, thanks to the loan with Fodemi and her hard work, she will be able to buy a small house for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: A portion of Najmadin's Group's $4 ,000 loan intends a member to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 38 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Lina works very hard to provide for them.

Lina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock such as noodles, juice, milk, bath soap, fabric conditioner, canned goods and soft-drinks to sell.

Lina has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, juice, milk, bath soap, fabric conditioner, canned goods and soft-drinks.

Lina would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as noodles, juice, milk, bath soap, fabric conditioner, canned goods and soft-drinks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosvilla

texts.en:
Rosvilla is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Rosvilla has a general store business in the Philippines. Rosvilla has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosvilla has been in this business for four years. In the future, Rosvilla would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, an iron and fabric for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, generator, table  and iron.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, table, iron and over sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and over machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a chair and a generator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's school fees.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima is a hardworking and optimistic woman of 42 years who lives in a remote village, Magurmari, in the district of Jalpaiguri, with her husband Nahir, aged 52 years, and one school-going son. Rahima and her husband both are uneducated and can sign their names only. But they are providing education to their son, who is a student of grade 9.

Rahima's husband is associated with a small business. He is an honest man who knows that to get ahead in life, it is necessary to fight. He works hard to provide her family a decent lifestyle, but his only income is insufficient to bear all the expenses of their family in the era of high prices. 

Thus, Rahima decided to start a business of dairy products, such as milk, butter, curd and paneer (cottage cheese). She will sell the dairy products to her neighbors. 

Rahima needs capital to purchase a dairy cow. Her biggest motivation is her family, for which she fights and makes an effort every day, with the goal of seeing them happy. She hopes this business will fulfill her dream. So, she has taken a loan from Kiva's partner, BJS.

In the future, she wants to purchase more cows and improve her business for a secured future.

She is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to start a dairy business.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio de 63 años de edad, es un hombre muy dedicado a su trabajo y luchando en su pequeño negocio como fotógrafo, después que su esposa murió, tubo que hacerse cargo de sus 3 hijos, manifiesta que fue duro enfrentar solo las adversidades de la vida, sin su esposa a su lado, pero a pesar de que no tenia el apoyo de ella en el cuidado de sus hijos él supo educar y sacar adelante a todos. Hay algo que lo caracteriza es su valor y entereza por la calidad en lo que le gusta hacer la fotografiá es su profesión desde que fundo su pequeño negocio hace 34 años, él a trabajado con sus hijos a su lado. Ahora ya son grandes pero se que en su memoria tienen el recuerdo de los días de lucha que junto a su padre hicieron hombro a hombro para estar a donde hoy han llegado.    


El préstamo sera utilizado para la compra de mas equipo para el estudio fotográfico y compra de mercaderías ya que en su negocio vende también papelería, ropa y demás que necesita comprar para fortalecer y robustecer su pequeño negocio.          

 Ignacio  tiene muchos planes, pero hay uno que nos manifestó que desea cumplir y es que cuando él ya no pueda trabajar en un futuro que su negocio sea su fuente de sustento, por esa razón desea fortalecerlo para que siga funcionando ya que su esperanza esta puesta en el.
texts.en:
Ignacio is 63 years old.  He is very dedicated to his work and his small photography business.  After his wife died, he had to care for his three children.  He says that it was hard to face the challenges of life alone, without his wife at his side, but in spite of not having her support caring for their children, he was able to educate them all and move them forward.  He is known for his courage and integrity and the quality of what he likes to do.  

Photography has been his profession since he started his small business 34 years ago.  He worked with his children at his side.  Now they are adults, but he knows that they remember the days that they worked together with their father to be where they are today.  

He will use this loan to purchase more equipment for his photography studio, and to purchase merchandise, since his business also sells stationery, clothing, and other items that he needs to purchase to strengthen his business.  

Ignacio has many plans, but there is one that he says he wants to achieve, which is when he is no longer able to work in the future, that his business continues as his source of support.  For this reason, he wants to strengthen it so that it will continue, since he is putting his hope in it.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for his photography studio and purchase other merchandise.

loans.name: Luz Stella

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de 33 años de edad felizmente casada, que debido situación económica en su familia  tuvo que  salir a trabajar, pues las malas condiciones económicas en su hogar lo pedían y más aún cuando tienen un hijo de 1 año de edad de por medio, trabaja en el sector de comercio vendiendo diferentes productos como comidas, dulces entre otras cosas, actividad que aprendió gracias a su esposo que también es comerciante y en gran parte a su familia en pocas palabras el comercio está en sus venas, solicita un crédito para la compra de víveres, abarrotes, servilletas, bolsas de empaque, cajas de empaque con los cuales puedan cubrir la demanda actual de clientes que tiene ya que no tienen el presupuesto suficiente para abarcarlos. 
Su gran sueño es poder poseer un negocio grande, y un carro para desplazar la mercancía hacia los clientes, mejorando la calidad de la empresa y el servicio, posicionándose como gran distribuidora de comidas con unos buenos ingresos para darle un futuro a su hijo, un negocio con el que esta pueda sostener a sus dos padres cuando estén en una avanzada edad y a si mismo.
texts.en:
Luz is 33 years old and happily married.  Due to her family's financial situation, she had to go out to work, since the bad financial conditions of her household needed it, especially when they had a one year old child.  She works as a merchant, selling different products, including food, candy, and other items.  She learned this work from her husband who also works as a merchant and in large part from her family, since sales in their veins.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies, groceries, napkins, packing bags, and packing boxes so that she can cover her customers' demand, since she does not have the budget to cover them.  Her dream is to have a large store and a car to deliver the merchandise to her customers, improving the quality of her business and service.  She would be positioned as a large food distributor with good profits to give her child a future and a business that could sustain her two parents and herself when they are at an advanced age.

loans.use: to purchase  supplies, groceries, napkins, packing bags, and packing boxes

loans.name: Sumati

texts.en:
Sumati is 31 years old; she studied up to grade 4. She is married, and her husband is engaged in a small business. They have two daughters who are in school and in grade 11 and 9 respectively. They live in their own house in a small village, Magurmari, in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Sumati's husband Upendranath, aged 42 years, got an education up to grade 9. He is engaged in a small business. But his income in not sufficient for his family to lead a decent lifestyle, and he is also unable to afford the money for his daughters’ education. 

Sumati, though a housewife, has decided to help her husband by doing some work on her own. She thought to start a business of selling Ayurveda medicine (medicines made from medicinal plants and herbs), which is a profitable business, and she also has experience in this field. Sumati’s father is an Ayurveda doctor. She has learned about Ayurveda medicines from her father. 

She is requesting the loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase medicines from the medicine wholesalers and initially start the business from her house. With the development of the business, she will rent a shop in the market. She hopes the loan will enable her to reach her goal.

Her dream is to expand her business. She also would like to give better education to her daughters and a financial upgrade to her family.   

She is really grateful to the lenders for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase Ayurveda medicines (medicine made from different medicinal herbs) to start a business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 18-year-old single young man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a very small house. Ali's mother works as an employee in a local firm where she gets a small income. Ali is a student in a local university where he studies primary education. He wants to get a BA degree and find a job as a teacher. 

Ali took a Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies, and with this laptop, Ali will be able to do his homework and write reports. Ali appears in the photo with his laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Montaser

texts.en:
Montaser is a twenty-three-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a very small house. Montaser's brother works as an employee in a local firm where he earns a low income. Montaser is a student in a local university where he studies Mathematics. He want to take the BA degree and find a job as a teacher. 

Montaser took a USD Murabha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Montaser will be able to do his homework and write reports. Montaser appears in the photo with his laptop

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Anjali

texts.en:
Anjali is a 45-year-old woman from the remote village, Magurmari, in Jalpaiguri district. She is married, a housewife and a mother of three. Her husband, Madan, is engaged in his own small business. They live in their own kaccha house (a house made of mud, bamboo and straw).

Anjali's husband works very hard. He makes cane baskets and sells his products on foot throughout the different markets near her place of residence. With the earnings from his business, somehow they manage their household expenses. But it is quite impossible for him to manage his children's educational costs with his small income. So, in order to make additional income, Anjali wants to start a business of dried fish.

She has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase dried fish from the wholesale market and sell them in her locality. Anjali hopes to generate good earnings from this business and provide her family a better quality of life.

She dreams to upgrade their kachha house to a concrete-made house in the future with the earnings from her business.

She wants to give her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a young housewife of only 20 years. She is from a remote village, Raipara, in the district of Jalpaiguri. There she lives with her husband and their only son, who is too young to attend school. Anita has a higher secondary education (grade 12), and her husband has a primary education.

Anita's husband is engaged in a small business, but his income is too low to give a proper wellbeing to the family. Anita is a woman of strong mental strength and dedication. She concretely knows what she wants and goes after it with strength. She wants to help the family financially. She wants to start a milk supply business by purchasing a cow, but she needs financial support.

With this aim, she has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner), which gives loans to rural women to start new businesses. She plans to purchase a cow and forage with the loan. She will start delivering milk from door to door to her neighbors. She hopes that it will be a lucrative business, as milk is in much demand in the present market, and the business will give her good earnings to overcome the financial hurdles.

Anita plans to invest the earnings from the business in the further acquisition of livestock. She has also been planning to set aside some money for her son's education. She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to start a milk supply business.

loans.name: Chakina

texts.en:
Chakina is 45 years old. She is a married woman and a housewife. She is illiterate and can sign her name only. She is blessed with three sons. She and her husband could not provide education to their sons due to their financial problem. One of them is a cycle-van puller, and the other two are uneducated.  

Chakina's husband Afa, aged 55 years, is also uneducated and is also a cycle-van puller (a vehicle that is used to carry people and loads in rural areas). They live in the small village, Magurmari, in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Chakina's husband earns for his family by carrying people and goods on his cycle van. So, by pulling his van, Chakina's husband earns money for his family’s expenses.  Sometimes he gives it on hire and earns additional income. Now the cycle van needs repairing, as it was damaged due to an accident. So, it has become difficult for him to meet the basic needs of the family.

Chakina heard about Kiva’s partner, BJS, and has taken a loan from them to purchase a cycle-van for her husband. The loan will serve as a complement to the purchase of a new cycle-van, which will allow him to strengthen the business. She hopes to improve his husband's service, expand his customer base and have better earnings.

She wishes that her husband continues his work in order to support her family financially and purchases more cycle vans in the future with the profit from this business.

She and her husband give their hearty thanks to both BJS and Kiva for funding them.

loans.use: to purchase a cycle-van for business purposes.

loans.name: Kabita

texts.en:
Kabita lives in Magurmari with her husband, Bidhan, and three school-going children (one son and two daughters), who are in grades 10, 10 and 7 in Magurmari in Jalpaiguri district.  
 
Kabita's husband is a farmer by profession. He grows green vegetables like beans, bitter gourd, ladies finger (okra), etc. on their ancestral land, and sells them in the local markets. That does not provide him with enough money to look after his family well. 

So, to earn additional income, Kabita started an animal husbandry five years back. Her parents taught her how to raise cattle. Now she has one cow. She sells milk from door to door in her locality and earns money for her family. She would like to have more cattle to develop her business, but doesn't have the capital.

Kabita asked for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase a cow and forage. She hopes it will improve her business and give her good earnings to strengthen her family's financial condition.

She is planning to use the profits from her business to increase the headcount of her herd and to save some money for the future to make a concrete-made house.

She thanks to both her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to purchase a cow and forage for her animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Aroti

texts.en:
Aroti is a 25-year-old married woman. She and her husband are illiterate and just know how to sign their names. They live in the small town of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri. They have two children. 

Her husband is associated with the agricultural business. Due to lack of capital, she decided to help her husband by taking a loan for buying seeds, fertilizers, etc. for maize cultivation. She applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). They decided to grow maize, as it is a very demandable crop in their area. Aroti is very much hopeful to earn a good profit after the harvest of the crop.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.ru:
Равшан жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 39 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Равшан живёт со своей семьёй в маленькой деревушке. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Равшана также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Равшан занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Также Равшан подрабатывает мастером в местной мастерской. От данного бизнеса он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Равшану в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота.  Сейчас Равшан хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Равшан очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Ravshan is a cheerful and hardworking 39-year-old man. He is married and has two children. He first contacted Arvand when he learned of the possibility of obtaining financial support. Ravshan lives with his family in a small town. He does not have a higher education because his family's financial hardship kept him from going to a university. Ravshan's wife doesn't have an education either and as a housewife takes care of domestic duties and raising the children. To earn an income to support the family Ravshan runs his own business feeding and selling cattle. He also works sometimes as a skilled workman at a local workshop. He earns a good income from the business. His wife also helps with the work by selling milk from the cows. Now Ravshan wants to expand his livestock herd and his business so he is asking Arvand for a loan to buy cattle. Ravshan very much hopes for a good outcome and thanks Arvand for its support in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Dipa

texts.en:
Dipa is a 22-year-old married woman who stays with her husband and two children. Both Dipa and her husband are illiterate and only able to sign their names, but one of their children is receiving education from a village school of Maynaguri and is in grade 1, and the other one is below school-going age.

Dipa is a housewife and her husband is running his agribusiness. Dipa’s husband is a hardworking farmer and works from dawn to dusk in the field. Now they decided to cultivate eggplant on their land.

The land where she is standing will be used for growing eggplant. Eggplant cultivation is a very profitable crop and is used in many Indian dishes. After the harvest, they will sell the eggplants in the wholesale market. 

They desire to cultivate different types of vegetables and grow their agribusiness with the profit from their business. Dipa is highly grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for cultivation of eggplant.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is a very courageous 34-year-old woman with many hopes. She is a housewife of Maynaguri town and the mother of three children. She has received no education and just knows how to sign her name. Her children are pursuing their studies. Jayanti is very much optimistic about the education of their children. She aims for them to lead a decent lifestyle with a good education.  

Jayanti’s husband is a farmer. He has an agricultural business. They have a plot of land just a few minutes away from their home, where her husband cultivates different seasonal vegetables and sells them to the market. Jayanti gives assistance to her husband in this work. 

Now they want to add eggplants to the vegetables they grow. She is requesting this loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy eggplant seeds to cultivate, and to avoid contamination of the crop from insects and diseases, they will buy fertilizers and pesticides. 

In the future, with the profit from her business, she dreams to develop her farming and family condition as well. 

She is thankful to Kiva and BJS. She hopes they will give her extensive support in the near future and provide a more helpful environment for her.

loans.use: to buy eggplant seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to cultivate eggplant.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.ru:
Санобар позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 31 года. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства Санобар мечтала стать учительницей, но так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Санобар выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома,  Санобар никогда не сидит без дела. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.

Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Санобар вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Санобар выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса она получает хороший доход. Муж Санобар также работает в местной мастерской и его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Санобар с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Санобар заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Sanobar is an optimistic and hard-working woman, 31 years of age. SHe is married and has three children. She lives in a small rural village. As a child, Sanobar dreamt of becoming a schoolteacher, but her life circumstances were such that she was not able to receive higher education due to her family's financial hardship. Right after finishing secondary school, Sanobar was given away in marriage. And thus she became a homemaker. But even spending her days at home, Sanobar is never idle. She and her husband are doing everything within their power in order to provide their children with all necessity.
In order to have constant income to support their family, Sanobar and her husband launched their own business. They raise livestock. Sanobar raises livestock and then sells meat and milk. She receives a decent income. Sanobar's husband also works as a handyman in a local workshop, bringing in additional income to the family. Together they manage to earn an average-level income. So far they lack funds in order to provide for all family needs. 
At present Sanobar and her husband would like to buy several more heads of livestock for raising. This is why Sanobar reached out to Arvand for a loan to buy livestock. Sanobar thanks Arvand in advance for its support which will help improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his store

loans.name: Waseem

texts.en:
Waseem is 29 years old. He appears in this photo and is a single young man from Jabalia City. Waseem lives with his family in a very small house. Four years ago, he started his own store where he maintains and repairs bicycles. It is a good business and demand is high due to the huge use of bicycles in his city. 

Waseem is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to buy more repair parts for bicycles. He will use his loan to increase his productivity and income.

loans.use: to buy bicycle repair materials

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 19-year-old single young man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a very small house. Ahmad's father works as an employee in a local firm where he earns a low income and Ahmad is a student in a local university where he studies commerce. He wants to earn a bachelors degree and find a job. 

Ahmad is requesting a USD Murabha loan from FATEN to buy a new laptop for his studies. He will use his loan to be able to do his homework and write reports. Ahmad appears in this photo with his laptop.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his studies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy toys to resell.

loans.name: Noong Luong 4 Group

texts.en:
Thao, 26, lives with her husband and two school-aged children. 

Her family's main source of income comes from cultivating rice, planting vegetables, breeding 50 chickens, and raising a buffalo for ploughing. Taho's husband earns additional income to cover living expenses and tuition fees, as a construction worker. 

Thanks to Thao's and her husband's effort, their children consistently attend school. However, Thao wants her children to have both a basic standard of living and an abundant life. For that reason, Thao is determined to expand her business and purchase small fish to increase yield. 

Thao requests a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program. This is her 4th ACE loan. She said that she has benefited from both the money and the training received from ACE. ACE has helped her to develop her business since the first loan. 

She dreams that her children will go to a well-known university and have a better life. 

In the picture, Thao is standing first from the right.

loans.use: to buy small fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and coffee seedlings to prepare the land.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis se dedica a la agricultura, la crianza de animales menores y la ganadería entonces él sigue cultivando productos secos como por ejemplo papa, cebada, trigo y otros. Ya son 17 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono.
texts.en: Luis works in agriculture, small animal husbandry and cattle raising. Therefore he continues growing dry products, for example potato, barley, wheat and others. He has been making a living from this business for 17 years already and it's going very well for him. On this occasion, he needs the loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre soltero de 32 años de edad, el vive junto a su hijo en el Departamento de Sololá.
El es un hombre con muchas ganas de salir adelante junto a su familia. Actualmente se dedica a la compraventa de banano en la ciudad capital, esta actividad lo viene realizando desde hace 5 años,  ya que a través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias que le ayudan aportar a la economía de su familia.
El ahora ha observado que este producto tiene una fuerte demanda, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 6,000 para la compra de banano ya que desea ampliar su negocio y así incrementar sus ganancias.
El sueño de don Diego es mejorar su economía, a través de lo que realiza y así darle una mejor  calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Diego is a single 32 year old man. He lives with his son in the town of Sololá. He is a man with lots of desire to get his family ahead. Currently, he works in trading bananas in the capital city. He has been carrying out this activity for the past 5 years. Through what he does, he earns income and profits that help him support the economy of his family.

Now he has observed that this product has a strong demand, for which is why he is applying for a loan of Q 6,000 for the purchase of banana. He wishes to grow his business and therefore increase his income. Diego's dream is to improve his economy by what he does and therefore give a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Sulma Del Carmen

texts.es: Sulma de 46 años de edad, no tiene grado de estudio,  está casada su esposo es empleado, tiene 3 hijos que estudian, ella a trabajado en el cafetín desde hace diez años, trabajo que está a 30 minutos de su casa, se transporta a pie. Necesita el dinero para invertirlo en agricultura, comprara abonos, herbicidas y fertilizantes, desea comprar ganado y tener un buen capital para que su familia tenga ingresos no solo de su empleo.
texts.en: Sulma, 46, does not have a school degree. She is married; her husband is employed, she has 3 children who study. She has worked in a café for the past 10 years. The job is 30 minutes from her house; she gets there on foot. She needs the money to invest it in agriculture. She will buy manure, herbicides and fertilizers. She wishes to buy cattle and have good capital so that her family can have income not only from her job.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides and fertilizerse.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to assist her crops.

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita, age 28, is a homemaker and stays with her husband Garen in the small town of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri. She and her husband both have completed their class IV education (grade 4). They are raising their three children together. All of them go to school and they are in class IX (grade 9), class VI (grade 6) class III (grade 3), respectively. 

Her husband is associated with a seedlings business. He sells small seedlings and saplings of different types of crops to farmers. They have their own land near their home. Namita’s husband buys seeds and seedlings and grows small saplings of different crops on their land. Then he plucks the saplings and sells them to the market.

Due to a lack of finances, Namita and her husband couldn’t use their land, so she decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy new seeds and seedlings for planting in their own land and to cover her labor costs. 

She hopes it will be profitable for them in the future. She dreams of purchasing more land for her seedlings plantation business, which will improve the financial condition of their family. She hopes her children will receive a good education and not suffer in the future and can live happily throughout their lives.

She is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: To buy new seeds and seedlings and to cover labor costs.

loans.name: Marco Fidel

texts.es: Marco es un comerciante de 50 años de edad padre de 6 hijos que hace ya varios años se dedica a la compra-venta de frutas y verduras que distribuye en la plaza de mercado y en su sector residencial, esta actividad la fue adquiriendo poco a poco con la experiencia que iba ganando como trabajador en la plaza de mercado, hasta que decidió ser una persona independiente y montar su propio negocio, ha tenido dificultades básicamente económicas, y de ubicación como lo podemos observar en la foto donde distribuye su producto en un sendero lo que le ha retrasado diferentes proyectos productivos, que según lo impulsaran hacia la grandeza por esta razón solicita un crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras como bananos, plátanos, papa, cebolla de rama, mangos, aguacates entre otros y empezar con uno de sus proyectos el cual agilizara la comercialización de sus productos en sus dos puntos de venta, su sueño es ampliar su comercialización de productos y llegar a todos los rincones de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Marco is a 50 year old businessperson and father of 6 children. For a number of years he has been buying and selling fruit and vegetables that he sells in the market in his neighborhood. This knowledge was achieved little by little with the experience he had as a worker in the market. Then he decided to become an independent person and opened his own business. He has had problems, mainly financial but also of location. As we can see in the photo he is selling on a sidewalk. This has slowed down several of his projects, which he plans will lead him to greater things.

He has requested a loan to buy fruits and vegetables like bananas, plantains, potatoes, green onion. mangoes, avocados, etc. which he will sell at two different places. His dream is to expand his sales of his product to reach all the corners of the city.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits and more strategically expand his business with his second Kiva loan

loans.name: Pinki

texts.en:
