Most of the time, these marginalized people have land to grow crops, but due to financial constraints, are not able to buy fertilizers, seeds, or irrigation facilities.

Barnali (hand raised), 39, hails from Nandakumarpur village of South 24 Parganas district of West Bengal, India. Her family comprises her husband and a son and a daughter who are in different stages of schooling. Her husband usually goes to different villages in search of a job. The current income is not sufficient, and with the daunting responsibilities that she will face in the future, as in financing their children’s education, it is imperative that she uses the land for paddy cultivation. 

She is also the leader of Subham Self Help Group (SHG). The SHG helps in training, mutual sharing of ideas, motivation and help. As a group, they are usually involved in different jobs to reduce the risk of business failure. 

Barnali needs a loan for the paddy cultivation, for which she will need to buy fertilizers, seeds, etc. She expects to reap a profit of INR 50,000 per year. With finance in place, she can expect to bring stability to her family. The lady also has a good credit history and has never defaulted.

Other members in the group have a diverse set of requirements, which includes betel vine farm preparation, potato and onion businesses, and pisciculture. In total, they require a loan of INR 140,000.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Nabina Self Help Group

texts.en:
Namita (hand raised) is a native of the village of Narendrapur in West Bengal. Though she is nearing 50, she always yearned for a bright future for her son and educated him till graduation. But even after graduating, her son is unemployed. She has got her only daughter married. Her son and husband help her in paddy cultivation. The income is not enough to meet the family’s expenditures. She wants to take on additional paddy cultivation to have sustainable income and also to make her son independent.

Namita is requesting a loan to buy high quality paddy seeds, fertilizers and manure. She hopes to buy new land for cultivation from her savings in the future. This will increase her earnings and fulfil her dream of a secure future for her family.

The Nabina Self Help Group needs a loan of 150,000 Indian rupees to start their enterprises, which will be used for paddy cultivation, a medical shop and a grocery shop by other members of the group. In their endeavours, these women are helped by local NGO Sabuj Sangha, which works in the field of women's empowerment and provides them with the necessary training to carry on various income-generating activities. They really thank the investors for their humane perspective.

loans.use: to buy high quality paddy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Mousumi Self Help Group

texts.en:
The Mousumi Self Help Group hails from the village of Narayanpur in West Bengal. The village has good agricultural land and water bodies but is extremely backward. Most of the houses in the village are made of mud with straw roofs. The village is rich in courage, spirit and the ideas of its womenfolk who want to be something in life. And the change initiator is the local NGO Sabuj Sangha, which provides training to women in rural areas so that they can contribute to the income of their families and improve their living standards.

Bandana (hand raised) leads the group and cultivates paddy. Her husband helps her in the business. Her son studies in fifth standard while her daughter is just 3 years old. The income from the paddy business is not enough to sustain the family. So Bandana wants to open an electronics repair shop in the village, for which she is requesting a loan. She hopes this new venture will bring in sustainable income to support her children’s higher education. She will use the loan to buy copper wire, spare parts and new tools for her electronics repair shop. Bandana is looked upon as a role model by the other women in the group, and she often motivates them to be independent.

The group needs a loan of 130,000 Indian rupees. Other members in the group will use their portions for paddy cultivation and fish farming. Such a group of hardworking and experienced ladies needs to be appreciated to make them the forerunners in much needed reforms.

loans.use: to buy copper wire, spare parts and new tools to open an electronics repair shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to help her coffee crops in this new season

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime ha sido prácticamente toda su vida un trabajador del campo produciendo y cuidando cerdos de engorde y levante. Esta actividad la aprendió desde que era un niño por enseñanza de su padre.
Actualmente ejerce esta actividad alternándola con el oficio de acarreos y mandados en su antiguo vehículo. Trabaja desde las 5:00 am hasta las 8:00 am con sus cerdos, luego desde las 8:00 am hasta las 6:00 pm trabaja con su vehículo haciendo todo tipo de transportes, para finalizar de nuevo con el cuidado de sus animales en las tardes y parte de la noche.
En general es un hombre al que no le importa tener que trabajar duramente para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
El solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento a su vehículo como correcciones en el motor, cadenas y otras reparaciones, y de esta manera poder seguir laborando.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener un vehículo nuevo y más grande con el que pueda generar algún empleo y obtener así más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime has been a farm worker for practically his whole life, producing and caring for pigs, which he raises and fattens. He learned this work when he was a boy, through his father's teaching.

Now he practices this activity, alternating it with his work of hauling and doing errands in his old vehicle. He works from 5:00 am to 8:00 am with his pigs, then from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm he works with his vehicle, doing all types of transport, to finish again with the care of his animals in the afternoon and part of the night.

In general, he is a man to whom it doesn't matter if he has to work hard to bring sustenance to his household.

He is applying for a loan to do maintenance on his vehicle, such as repairing the motor and the drive train and other repairs, and in this way to be able to continue working.

His great dream is to be able to have a new, bigger vehicle with which he could generate some employment and thus obtain more income for his family.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his vehicle, such as repairing the motor and drive train, and other repairs.

loans.name: Rokiyas

texts.en:
Rokiyas (pictured here), age 50, lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. She has one son and one daughter. Both her children are married and they live separately. 

Rokiyas sells groceries from home, while her husband is assisting his wife in the business. She wants to expand her grocery inventory by buying more grocery items. That’s why she applied for a loan. 

Rokiyas is Cham Muslim. The Cham are an ethnic minority in Cambodia, with a population estimated at 200,000 to 300,000 out of Cambodia's population of about 13 million people (2008). The Cham have a proud past, with the Champa kingdom ruling much of what is present-day Vietnam from the 2nd century to 9th century. The modern history of the Cham in Cambodia is marked by tragedy, as the genocidal Khmer Rouge prioritized the extermination of Muslims, Buddhists, and others of faith during their rule from 1975 to 1979.

loans.use: To expand her grocery inventory by buying more grocery items.

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Kheng (in the photo) lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  She has two sons and five daughters. All of their children are now married, and one still lives with the family. 

Kheng buys silk products from her fellow villagers and transports them to sell in other provinces far away from her home. Her husband is a primary school teacher. Kheng wants to replace her motorbike with a new one for her family's transportation because the old one breaks down very often. 

Hence, she decided to request a loan!

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 45 years old and married with three adult children. She lives with her husband and children in Kang Meas district, Kampong Cham province. For years, Srey has operated a farming business, earning a daily income of USD 3.00. The profit she earns in the business is used for food, clothes, allowances for her school-going children and other commodities.

Srey is borrowing a loan of USD 1,000 to buy a motorcycle to fulfill the family’s transportation needs. This way she can prevent her family members from paying for daily taxi service while going to their desired destinations. In the near future, she is aiming to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to fulfill the family’s transportation needs.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 40 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Mary Jane has a buying and selling of scrap business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more recycled materials to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for three years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support four children. She is married and has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines.

Norma requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Norma is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money; she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
This is Rosalie, 31, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Jubert, and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rosalie owns and oversees the operations of their Tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of Tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business, the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

Rosalie hopes to have additional units of tricycle and dreams that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts, accessories and maintenance of their motorcycle.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Sarom (in the photo), age 48, lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. She has three sons and five daughters. Two of her children are married and live in a separate home, one works for a bakery and the other five are in school.

Sarom buys and sells recycling materials, while her husband is a motor taxi driver. She wants to buy additional recycling materials for resale, but she does not have capital. So, she decided to apply for a loan in order to help with her capital.

loans.use: To buy additional recycling materials for resale.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat (in the photo), age 30, lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. He has two sons. One son attends school and the other is still young.

Phat is a construction worker, while his wife is a garment factory worker. He has one old motorbike, but the motorbike breaks down very often and he wants to sell it. 

Hence, Phat applied for a loan to add to his own money from selling the old motorbike in order to replace it with a new one!

loans.use: To add to his own money to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina works hard to support two children. She is married and has a frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Filipina requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency.

Filipina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money; she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 61 years old and married with one child.

Dolores works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Dolores has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and earns an income from food vending.

Dolores aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Manuela

texts.es: Maria Manuela se dedica a la agricultura, la ganadería y a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Ella tiene sus terrenos de cultivos donde siembre mayormente papa y ella lleva a vender la papa a la ciudad de Pilcopata y de regreso compra hoja de coca para luego venderlo en la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes.
texts.en: Maria Manuela works in farming, raising cattle and small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She has a field where she mainly grows potatoes. She takes the potatoes to sell them in the city of Pilcopata, and on the way bag she buys coca leaves to later sell in the city of Cusco. She is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.en:
This is Mariela, 31, resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Joel, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses, as she also has a massage parlor for additional income. 

Mariela oversees and owns operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle unit that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community and she earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and accessories, and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. 

Mariela dreams of having more tricycles and hopes to give her children a good life and education. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work  and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay back microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, accessories and the maintenance of their motorcycle.

loans.name: Jaennie Mae

texts.en:
Jaennie Mae works hard to support her family. She is single and has a natural medicines business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Jaennie Mae is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money but also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is the age of 30 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a shoe shop in which he sells a variety of shoes. He buys shoes from different shoe manufacturing companies and sells from his shop. He has been selling gents shoes only but now he wants to offer ladies shoes as well, following customer demand. However, their major problem is the lack of available funds.
 
Therefore Asia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband will be able to buy ladies shoes as well. 

Asia is very happy to receive this loan and thanks Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy ladies shoes for reselling.

loans.name: Doris De Jesús

texts.es:
Doris es una dedicada ama de casa, amante a sus hijos y cuidadora de su hogar. Es separada y vive actualmente con sus dos hijos de los cuales uno de ellos es mayor de edad y le ayuda con gastos de la casa.
Ella deicidio iniciar con un negocio de preparación y venta de almuerzos en su casa, la idea se la dio un vecina que al ver todo el tiempo que tenia disponible quiso que ella prosperara como empresaria e independiente. Adicional a esto produce arepas en moderadas cantidades que vende a los alrededores de su vivienda.
Ella desea expandir su negocio y vender sus alimentos en tiendas y supermercados, además desea tener su propio restaurante en el cual pueda obtener ingresos estables para su familia.
Por esta razón requiere de un crédito para aumentar su capital de trabajo y comprar materia prima para la preparación de más arepas ya que le están haciendo muchos pedidos y desea cumplirlos todos.
Uno de sus grandes desafíos es la situación económica que actualmente esta atravesando.
texts.en:
Doris is a dedicated housewife, who loves her kids and takes care of her home. She is separated and now lives with her two children, of which one of them is an adult and helps her with the family expenses.

She decided to start a business making and selling lunches from home. A neighbor who saw how much free time she had gave her the idea, wanting her to become a prosperous and independent business owner. In addition to this, she makes arepas in moderate quantities which she sells in the area around her home.

She wants to expand her business and sell her food in shops and supermarkets. In addition, she wants to have her own restaurant in which she can make a stable income for her family.

For this reason, she is asking for a loan to increase her working capital and to buy primary ingredients to make more arepas, as she is getting a lot of orders and she wants to fill them all.

One of her greatest challenges is the difficult economic situation which she is now going through.

loans.use: increase her working capital and to buy primary ingredients to make arepas.

loans.name: Alfredo Augusto

texts.es: Alfredo tiene 22 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre e  hija de 5 años de edad. Alfredo  se dedica a hacer viajes en su vehículo el cual con mucho esfuerzo y apoyo a logrado comparar. Además, también se dedica a la venta de antojitos típicos  junto a su madre desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar su condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de una cocina de gas para continuar haciendo sus productos para la venta ya que para el negocio es su principal herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 22 years old and lives in his own home with his mother and five-year-old daughter. Alfredo provides transportation using his vehicle, which with a great deal of effort and support he has managed to buy.

In addition, he has been selling traditional snack foods with his mother for a long time, and this is how he supports his household. With the desire to improve his living conditions, he has made the decision to request this loan from FUSAI, in order to purchase a gas stove so that he can continue making his products to sell, as it is his main work tool for the business.

loans.use: To buy a gas stove.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La Sra. Victoria, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de productos naturales para la salud, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia a la vez continua con su negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de productos secos como maíz.
 La socia agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Victoria works in a business selling natural health products. She has been doing this business for quite some time, which brings her satisfaction both economically and personally. She is also continuing her business selling dry goods such as corn. She wants to be able to continue her work as this is how she supports her family.

She is asking for the loan to buy dry products such as corn.

She is thankful for the loan and promises to complete her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy dry products such as corn.

loans.name: Gulzhamal

texts.ru: Гулжамал, 43 года, замужем, есть двое детей. У Гулжамал- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, начав в 1999 году с покупки скота на 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулжамал, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеются 2 дойные коровы. Гулжамал реализует молоко и молочную продукцию на местном рынке. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулжамал обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота, что в будущем позволит ей накопить средства на обучение детей.
texts.en: Gulzhamal is 43, married and has two children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and raises livestock for a living, first starting in 1999 with 5,000 som worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, her monthly income is nearly 10,000 som, and she currently has two dairy cows on her farm which produce milk and other dairy products that she sells a local market.  To further develop her farm, Gulzhamal is seeking a loan of 70,000 som from Bai-Tushum and Partners to buy some cows.  These additional cows will allow her to earn and save more money for her children's education.

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Mobina's Group

texts.en:
Mobina is a 47-year-old lady who lives with her husband and five children.

She is taking out a loan to purchase raw materials for sewing handmade embroidery. Most of her family members are involved in this business at home, and all of them are expert in their profession and sew very fine bridal dresses.

Due to demand they are facing a shortage of material and so are unable to sew enough fine embroidery. Therefore Mobina has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so she can buy more stocks of threads, fancy cloths, precious stones, sequins and pearls of various colors for her embroidery business.

Mobina is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, precious stones, sequins and pearls of various colors.

loans.name: Tierra Blanca  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Tierra Blanca está formado por 7 socias y 2 socios quienes viven las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad que se caracteriza por ser de clima frió, por su situación geográfica tienen varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, es desde 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta ciudad tiene una gran riqueza cultural y natural. Su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones, son personas amables y gentiles quienes ofrecen una buena hospitalidad a sus visitantes, laboran en diferentes actividades las que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Maritza, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos de 17, 13 y 2 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo pasa en casa debido a una discapacidad, su esposo se dedica laborar como supervisor de seguridad, no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando.
Doña Maritza pasa en casa pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la cría de pollos y cuyes, también se dedica a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su hogar. El dinero de su crédito es para comprar pollos, cuyes y el alimento para animales. Su meta es tener más animales de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank Tierra Blanca is made up of 7 members, and 2 members who live on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its cold climate, for its geographical location with various places to enjoy nature, and has been a World Heritage Site since 1999. It is a city with great cultural and natural wealth.

One of the members of this group is Maritza, who is 33 years old, lives with her partner and has three children of 17, 13 and 2 years old. Her first daughter goes to high school and her second son lives at home due to a disability, her husband works as a security supervisor. They don't have their own home and live in a rented place.

Maritza stays at home but to support the family finances she raises chickens and guinea pics, she also works in agriculture growing what they eat at home. The money from the loan will be used to buy chickens, guinea pigs and animal feed. Her goal is to have more, better quality animals.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es: Brigida vive en la ciudad del Cusco y se dedica a la agricultura, la ganadería y la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ella en sus tierras de cultivo siembre maíz, papa, cebada, trigo, tarwi, habas y otros para luego venderlas en diferentes mercados. Ella también se dedica al engorde de ganado. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar un ganado.
texts.en: Brigida lives in the city of Cusco and she works in agriculture, cattle raising, and the raising of small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. In her fields she plants corn, potatoes, barley, wheat, tarwi (Peruvian lupin), beans and other crops for later sale in different markets. She also fattens cattle. Now she needs a loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Yenny; La socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de botica, la socia vende diferentes productos como medicinas, jarabes, pastillas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pastillas, jarabes entre otros.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Her name is Yenny. She works in her pharmacy business, selling different types of products such as medicines, syrups, tablets, etc. She has been in this business for quite some time. It brings her both economic and personal satisfaction. She wants to continue working in this way to keep on supporting her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy tablets and syrups, etc.

She is happy to get a loan and promises to complete the repayments.

loans.use: to buy tablets and syrups, etc.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane, 42, resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Ricky, a tour guide, and is a mother. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mary Jane is a dried fish vendor. She buys different kinds of dried fish from her suppliers and then sells it in the market. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more dried fish to sell. Mary Jane dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to give her children a good life and education. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay back microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more dried fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Zhyparkul

texts.ru: Жыпаркул 46 лет, замужем, 5 детей. Семья очень дружная, отношения в семье очень хорошие. Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Жыпаркул имеет среднее образование, она ответственная, целеустремленная, и доброжелательная. Жыпаркул в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, с 1996 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с приобретения скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Жыпаркул в хозяйстве имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 3 лошади и 10 овец, а также есть земельный надел размером 3,15 ГА, на котором выращивает картофель, пшеницу, ячмень и эспарцет. Также имеется доход от продажи молока и молочной продукции. Ее деятельность приносит доход около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жыпаркул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля элитных сортов и ГСМ для весенних посевных работ. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее улучшение урожайности и увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет накопить деньги на обучение детей.
texts.en: Zhyparkul is 46, married and has five children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education, and is a responsible, goal-oriented and friendly woman.  She raises livestock and grows crops for a living, first setting up her farm in 1996 with 10,000 som.  Her family is very close, and her husband and children help her manage the farm.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, she currently has 3 dairy cows, 3 horses and 10 sheep on her farm, as well as a 3.15 hectare plot of land for growing potatoes, wheat, barley and sainfoin, and also makes money selling milk and dairy products.  Her farm brings in about 10,000 som per month, which helps pay for her family's food and other living expenses.  To further develop her farm, Zhyparkul is seeking a loan of 50,000 som from Bai-Tushum and Partners to buy premium-variety potato seeds and petroleum products for the spring planting season.  She plans on using any extra income due to the loan to further expand her farm and increase her harvests, and also hopes to set aside some money for her children's education.

loans.use: buy potato seeds and petroleum products for the spring planting season

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim, aged 38, is a married woman. She is a hardworking and brave mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Being a mother, she wants to provide better facilities for her children, and this is the reason for her working extremely hard - to keep her children smiling.

She started sewing clothes after the birth of her two children, when she observed that her husband couldn't provide everything necessary for them. Then she decided to start tailoring work at home and since then she has been sewing clothes for her community. She wants to enhance the beauty of her craft so she would like to buy a Juki sewing machine. The professionals use this machine for tailoring because of its speed and fine performance.

She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives and the local community. She has requested a loan to buy a new Juki sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. 

Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a Juki sewing machine and packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Rubén Yunior

texts.es:
Rubén ha sido un hombre muy trabajador desde los 18 años, y hoy en día es un feliz padre de familia que hace hasta lo imposible por sus dos hijos y su esposa.
El tiene un negocio de venta de mercancía a crédito por algunos barrios de la ciudad de Medellín (Colombia) donde vende sus productos y cada 15 días realiza el cobro de los mismos.
Esta actividad la viene ejerciendo desde hace ya algún tiempo y afortunadamente le ha generado muy buenas ganancias.
El desea expandirse hacia otros barrios de la ciudad y generar un empleo a uno de sus amigos, por esta razón acude a el beneficio que le otorga un préstamo para comprar un inventario más amplio de mercancías que le permita obtener más ventas y clientes, de esta manera podrá adquirir muchos más ingresos.
Uno de sus sueños es poder dejar de trabajar de manera ambulante y tener un almacén de todo tipo de artículos y accesorios para el hogar.
texts.en:
Ruben has been a very hardworking man since he was 18 years old, and today is the happy father of a family who does his utmost for his two children and his wife.

He has a business selling merchandise for a few neighborhoods in the city of Medellin (Colombia) where he sells products and every 15 days makes the charges from his sales. He has done this work for quite some time now, and luckily it has brought him very good earnings.

He wants to expand to other neighborhoods of the city and to generate employment for one of his friends, and for this reason is asking for a loan to buy a bigger inventory of merchandise which will enable him to get more sales and customers, and in this way he will be able to acquire much more income.

One of his dreams is to be able to stop working on foot and have a store with all sorts of goods and accessories for the home.

loans.use: to buy a larger inventory of merchandise.

loans.name: Buntha

texts.en:
Buntha (in the photo) is 35 years old and lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. He has two young children - one son and one daughter. His wife is a garment factory worker.

Buntha raises cows at home. In addition, he sells mangoes. He buys the mangoes under contract from villagers in the blooming season, and then waits till the harvesting season. During this time he needs to use pesticide to protect the mangoes from insects.

Bunthan wants to buy one cow to raise and purchase pesticide for the mangoes. Hence he has decided to apply for a loan in order to provide him with some capital.

loans.use: To buy one cow to raise and to purchase pesticide to protect mangoes from insects.

loans.name: Noemi Luz

texts.es:
La socia Noemí pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de ferreteria,  la socia vende pinturas, cementó entre otros, la socia continua vendiendo durante el dia,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea continuar trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pinturas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Noemi is part of the San Rafael village bank. She continues running her hardware store, she sells paint, cement, etc. She continues selling during the day. She has been in this business for a good time, which brings her both economic and personal satisfaction. She wants to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy paint, etc.

She is thankful for the loan offered and she promises to complete the set repayments.

loans.use: to buy paint, etc.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: karina vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo y se dedica a la venta de pollipapas y salchipapas de forma ambulatoria. Ya sonv arios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar ingredientes como por ejemplo papas, pollo y salchicha. Ella esta agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Karina lives in the city of Paucartambo and works selling pollipapas [chicken and fries] and salchipapas [sausage and fries] on foot. She has been in this business for many years and it is going well. 

This time she needs a loan to buy ingredients such as chips, chicken and sausage. 

She is grateful for the loan and promises to complete the repayments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy ingredients e.g. potatoes, chicken and sausage.

loans.name: Pom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Pom, born in 1992, is Thai ethnic person living in Mai Son district, Son La province, has been participating in the Institution since the end of 2013. The couple has a daughter is at the age of five.

Her family’s income source is primarily from cornfield cultivation and breeding animals at home. Every time she goes far away for working, the little daughter will accompany with the couple if she does not have to go to school. The life of the family is still difficult but very warm.

Coming into the new season, moreover her little daughter is at the age of school so her family incurs more costs, including big cost of fertilizer for plants. She wants the support for convenience of cultivation. She and her family hope this loan will help her family’s cornfield have a big harvest with high yield as well as the best initial preparation for her daughter to go to school for education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La señora Mariela sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de productos naturales para la salud, la socia continua viajando cada cierto tiempo a Quillabamba a vender su mercadería a los clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo  con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de  productos naturales para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Mariela continues working in her business selling natural health products. She continues traveling to Quillabamba every so often to sell her merchandise to her customers who request it. She has been in this business for a good time, which brings her both economic and personal satisfaction. She wants to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy natural products for her business.

She feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her installment repayments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy natural products for her business.

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.es: Hermenegilda se dedica a la venta de comida ella tiene un pequeño restaurante donde prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. Ella ha tenido su restaurante durante cinco años y ha tenido mucho éxito. Ella usualmente compra su mayor ingredientes. Ella compra fideos, azúcar, arroz y aceite, todo al por mayor, por lo que puede conseguir en el costo. Ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los ingredientes al por mayor. Ella es feliz sobre el préstamo y se compromete a realizar sus pagos puntualmente.
texts.en: Hermenegilda works in her restaurant business and prepares breakfasts, lunches, and dinners. She has had her restaurant for five years and has been very successful. She usually buys her ingredients wholesale. She buys noodles, sugar, rice, and oil, all at wholesale, so she can get them at cost. She is asking for the loan to invest in buying ingredients wholesale. She's happy about the loan and pledges to make her repayments punctually.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice, vegetables, noodles and other items.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
This is Azra from Pakistan! She is married and has a kid. She is 32 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
Azra has requested a loan for her husband, who offers Alu Chaat (a Pakistani dish) in the evening to the common people of his area. For this purpose he needs more potatoes, tomatoes, yogurt, onion, spices, etc. in large quantity. She helps her husband to prepare the Alu Chaat at noon. He wants to prepare more Alu Chaat for his customers because the demand has been increasing steadily over time. 

She hopes that through this loan her husband will be able to generate more income than previously. 

She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as potato, yogurt, spices and onion for making Alu Chaat.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Roxana pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL, la socia sigue dedicándose  a su negocio de venta de productos naturales para la salud, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cal le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, al socia continua vendiendo de forma independiente a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia a la vez es enfermera de profesión, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de  productos naturales para su negocio.
La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorga y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Roxana belongs to the SAN RAFAEL communal bank  and is still selling natural health products. She has been in business for some time and it brings her both economic and personal satisfaction.  She continues selling independently to customers who place orders.  She is also a nurse by profession.  Her goal is to continue working so she can support her family.

The loan requested by the borrower is to buy natural products for her business.  She is grateful for the support and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy natural products for her business.

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es:
Eulogio se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería. Él necesita el préstamo para comprar más animales, como los toros y las vacas. Él es feliz sobre el préstamo y se compromete a realizar sus pagos puntualmente. 

Nació en la comunidad de Jajahuana y vive en la comunidad en la que nació. (Jajahuana está situado en el distrito de Challabamba, dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo y el departamento de Cusco, Perú)
texts.en:
Eulogio works in agriculture and livestock farming.  He is in need of a loan to buy more livestock such as bulls and cows.  He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

He was born in the Jajahuana Community and still lives there.  (Jajahuana is in the district of Challabamba, province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco in Peru)

loans.use: To buy livestock.

loans.name: Oliva Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Oliva es socia del grupo de crédito Yanbal, se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas y vecinas con quienes comparte buenos momentos en cada reunión, los créditos le benefician para salir adelante con su familia. Vive por el sector de Balzay en Cuenca, donde su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y comercio, son personas que mantienen su cultura y tradiciones. 
La Señora Oliva tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 21 años de edad que está estudiando en una universidad de la ciudad y trabaja para pagarse sus estudios, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su madre con quien comparte los gatos  del hogar.
Doña Oliva se dedica a las tareas del campo, cría ganado, pollos y cuyes, también se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas que vende en la ciudad. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar de pollos y cuyes. Su meta es realizar más galpones para crecer en la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Oliva is a member of the Yanbal communal bank and she is requesting her second loan together with her friends and neighbors who share good times at each meeting.  The loans help her get ahead with her family.  She lives in the Balzay sector of Cuenca where people work in animal farming, agriculture and commerce.  They are people who maintain the local culture and traditions.

Oliva is 50 years old and a single mother of a 21-year-old son who attends the city university and works to pay for his education.  She lives with her mother and shares the household expenses.

Oliva is a farmer and raises cattle, chickens and guinea pigs.  She also works in agriculture and grows vegetables to sell in the city.  Her loan will be used to buy chickens and guinea pigs.  Her goal is to build more pens for her animals.

loans.use: To buy chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Lucila

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es una socia amable y gentil que forma parte del grupo Yanbal, vive por el sector de Molleturo en Cuenca, lugar en donde su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y comercio, son personas que mantienen su cultura y tradiciones. Este es el primer crédito que está realizando, fue invitada por una amiga y espera que los créditos le ayuden a crecer en su negocio.
La Sra. Rosa tiene 19 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 7 meses de edad, vive sola en una casa arrendada.
Doña Rosa labora en un restaurante de mesera desde hace un año y trabaja de domingo a domingo, en casa se dedica a la cría de pollos, estas actividades le dan solvencia económica. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de pollos y así continuar con el negocio. Su meta es tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Rosa is a kind, gentle member of the Yanbal communal bank.  She lives in the Molleturo sector in Cuenca, a place where the local people are involved in animal farming, agriculture and commerce.  They maintain the local culture and traditions.  This is her first loan; she was invite by a friend to join and she hopes the loans will help her continue to expand her business.

Rosa is 19 and a single mother with a 7-month-old daughter.  She lives alone in a rented house and works as a waitress at a restaurant where she has been employed for a year, working Sunday to Sunday.  At home she raises chickens to earn more income.  The loan she is requesting is to continue her business.  Her goal is to have her own restaurant one day.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Transito

texts.es: Transito tiene 56 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace mucho tiempo. Dicho negocio es el que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y junto a su compañero de vida dan a sus dos hijos lo necesario. Transito solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de frutas y verduras al por mayor para mejorar sus ventas e ingresos y poder así dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así hacer la inversión lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Transito is 56 years old and has worked selling fruit and vegetables for a long time. This business is what enables her to support her family and together with her life companion, they provide their two children with the necessities of life.

Transito is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of a variety of fruit and vegetables wholesale to improve her sales and income, and thus give her family better living conditions. 

She hopes to be able to count on this funding and make the investment as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Fransisca

texts.es: Fransisca vive en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo y se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono. Ella se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Fransisca lives in the beautiful city of Paucartambo and works in agriculture and cattle raising. She has been in this business for many years and it's going very well.

This time, she needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She feels happy about the loan and she promises to pay her installments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Diana Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. Diana está realizando su primer crédito en el grupo de crédito Yanbal, vive por el sector de Molleturo en Cuenca, lugar en donde su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y comercio, son personas que mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
La Señora. Diana tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 11 y 4 años, su primera hija estudia en una escuelita de la localidad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su madre, con quien comparte los gastos de su hogar.
Doña Diana labora desde hace 3 años en un restaurante como cocinera, pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la cría de cerdos y ganado, también a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su hogar. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir para la compra de ganado. Su meta es tener más animales para crecer en este negocio.
texts.en:
Diana is taking out her first loan with the Yanbal credit group. She lives in the Molleturo area in Cuenca. People there raise animals and work in agriculture and trade. They are people who maintain their culture and traditions.  

Diana is 27 years old. She is the single mother of 2 children, aged 11 and 4. Her oldest daughter goes to a little local school. She does not own her own home and so she lives with her mother, with whom she shares the household expenses. For 3 years, Diana has worked in a restaurant as a cook, but to contribute more to the household budget, she is raises pigs and cattle and also farms for household consumption. She is going to invest the money in buying cattle. Her goal is to have more animals to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Isabel pertenece al banco comunal EL ÉXITO, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 42 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de plantas hornamentales, la socia vende a todos su clientes que le solictan,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, a la vez la socia trabaja en una institución pública, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de plantas para su negocio.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Isabel belongs to the EL ÉXITO communal bank, the bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province and Cusco department.

She is 42 years old, has 3 children and is married. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling ornamental plants, which she sells to all the customers who request them. She has done this business for quite some time, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. At the same time she works in a public institution. She wants to be able to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family this way.

She is requesting a loan to buy plants for her business.

She appreciates the granted loan and promises to make her repayment installments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy plants for her business.

loans.name: Elmer Ruben

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal EL ÉXITO, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio  tiene 39 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es casada, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de semillas, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio e cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio vende las semillas a todos sus clientes que le solictan, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando con su negocio para de esta forma seguir apoyado a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas para su negocio.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
He belongs to the EL EXITO communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, and Cusco department.

He is 39 years old, has 2 children and is married. He alternates his daily activities with his seed sales business. He has been doing this business for quite some time, it's going well thanks to the effort he puts into his business every day. He sells seeds to all the customers who request them. He wants to continue working in this business to continue supporting his family this way.

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds for his business.

He is grateful for the loan provided and promises to make his agreed payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds for his business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David works in agriculture, transportation and cattle raising. He needs a loan to buy more animals such as ewes, bulls and cows.

This time he needs a loan to buy cattle. He is happy about the loan, and commits to make the payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Mayra Ines

texts.es:
La socia Mayra pertenece al banco comunal EL ÉXITO, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia  tiene 02 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de tienda de repuestos, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de retrovisores entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Mayra belongs to the EL EXITO communal bank. The bank is located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She has two children and lives with her partner. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling spare parts. She has been doing this business for quite some time. It's going well, thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She wants to keep working to keep supporting her family this way.

She is requesting a loan to buy rear-view mirrors, etc.

She is thankful for the loan and commits to making the agreed payments.

loans.use: to buy rear-view mirrors, etc.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergentes, pan, gaseosas, dulces, galletas y otros productos. Ella también se dedica al engorde de ganado y a la crianza de animales menores. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar al por mayor pues los costos son más baratos. 

Yaneth nació en la comunidad de Jajahuana y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació. (La comunidad de Jajahuana está ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Yaneth sells essential products such as rice, sugar, noodles, detergent, bread, beverages, sweets and cookies. She raises also small farm animals. This time, she is requesting a loan to buy supplies, such as rice and sugar in bulk, in order to pay lower prices.

Yaneth was born in the village of Jajahuana, where she still lives. This village is located in the district of Challabamba, Paucartambo province in the Cusco department, Peru.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk, such as rice and sugar, to get lower prices.

loans.name: Mariana Eloisa

texts.es:
En el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y además visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Esperanza Para  Superar.
En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 79 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo no trabaja por la edad.
Doña Mariana es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado salir adelante con su trabajo, ella tiene un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas en su casa, allí prepara y vende salchichas, cueritos, empanadas, jugos, colas y varios bocadillos más, son muchos los clientes que a diario llegan hasta su local a servirse sus platos, con esto ella se ayuda para salir adelante junto a su marido el cual ya no trabaja. 
Este crédito es para comprar víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios y ayuda que ha recibido de la institución. Sus sueños son tener salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The credit group Esperanza Para Superar [Hope to Get Ahead] meets every two weeks in the beautiful coastal town of  San Jacinto. It is surrounded by a beautiful beach where the Rio Portoviejo flows into the sea. it is visited by many tourists, both domestic and international.

This is where Mariana lives. She is 79 years old, married, and has four grown children who are on their own. Her husband doesn't work due to his age. Mariana is a woman who has always liked getting ahead with her job. She has a business selling fast food from her home. She cooks and sells sausages, pork rinds, empanadas, juice, soda and several other snacks. She has a lot of customers who go to her locale every day to eat her food. This is how she helps herself get ahead with her husband, who doesn't work anymore.  
 
This loan is to buy groceries she needs to make her food. she has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes the benefits and help she has received from the institution. Her dream is to stay healthy and keep going forward.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo al sur de la ciudad del Cusco, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajdora que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería pues ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo y otras, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono.
texts.en: Marina lives in the city of Paucartambo to the south of the city of Cusco. She is an enterprising and hard working woman who is dedicated to farming and livestock. She has various pieces of farm land where she plants potato, barley, wheat, among other items. At this time, she needs the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en: Pascasie is 27 years old. She is married to a driver and they have one child. With the loan, she would like to buy more items for sale in her mini supermarket, which she has been running for the past four years. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more snacks and beverages to sell in her mini supermarket.

loans.name: Srouy

texts.en:
Srouy (shown in photo) lives on an island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. He has five sons and three daughters. Five of his children are married; one is a camera man and two others have full-time employment. His wife stays at home and does housework. 

Srouy works for a printing shop. He wants to purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to work because they do not have their own transportation. And he will also use the rest of the loan to expand the house where he lives.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his children to drive to work and expand the house where he lives.

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Sony (shown in photo) is 34 years old and lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. She has two children: one attends school and the other one is still young. Her husband is an electrician. 

Sony gets tailored clothes ready by cleaning loose threads. She brings the clothes back to the garment factory and gets paid a fee. Sony needs a trailer to connect with her motorbike to transport the clothes, which is why she decided to apply for a loan: in order to buy a trailer.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to transport clothes

loans.name: Lesfia María

texts.es:
En el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y además visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Esperanza Para  Superar.
En este lugar vive la señora Lesfia, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido trabaja en una bananera. 
Ella gana un dinero extra vendiendo comidas rápidas, para lo cual cuenta con una carreta, vende hamburguesas, hot dog y también arroz con menestra y carne asada, trabaja todos los días en las tardes y noches pero los fines de semana también prepara desayunos y almuerzos, ella aprovecha estos días que es cuando más clientes llegan hasta el lugar a disfrutar de sus hermosas playas, lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva más de 6 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The beautiful spa town of San Jacinto, bordered by a beautiful beach, is the place where the Portoviejo river merges with the sea and is also visited by many domestic and foreign tourists. Every 15 days, the Hope to Overcome Credit Group meets.

Lesfia lives in this place. She is 42 years old and has a partner with whom she has three adult and independent children. Her spouse works for a banana company.

She earns extra money selling fast food for which she has a cart. She sells hamburgers, hot dogs and also rice with stew and roast beef. She works every day in the evening and night. On the weekend, she also makes breakfasts and lunches. She takes advantage of those days when more customers visit the place and enjoy the beautiful beaches. She has more than ten years experience in this work with which she is getting ahead.

This loan is to buy food to make her dishes. She has been with the loan group for more than six years and she likes it for the loan assistance provided. Her dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food.

loans.name: Romualda

texts.es: Romualda vive en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo y es una mujer emprendora y trabajdora que se dedica a la agricultura, ganaderia y crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes y chanchos.
texts.en: Romaulda lives in the beautiful city of Paucartambo and is an entrepreneurial and hard working woman who is dedicated to farming, livestock and raising young animals like guinea pigs and hens. At this time, she needs the loan to buy guinea pigs and pigs.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and pigs.

loans.name: Yenny Alexandra

texts.es:
En el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y además visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Esperanza Para  Superar.
En este lugar vive la señora Yenny, tiene 51 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 28 y 16 años de edad, el menor estudia  en colegio. Su marido es comerciante.
Doña Yenny junto a su marido tienen un negocio de compra y venta de pescado, camarón, conchas y todo tipo de mariscos, trabajan todos los días, en la madrugada el se desplaza hasta Puerto López donde compra a los barcos que llegan hasta la playa  ya que allí le salen más barato, mientras su esposo se encarga de las ventas en otras ciudades ella se encarga de vender ya sea en su casa o entregando a restaurantes, hoteles, cevicherías y clientes de la localidad, llevan más de 16 años dedicados a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante junto a su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar pescado, camarón, conchas y otros mariscos. Lleva más de 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the beautiful spa town of San Jacinto, bordered by a beautiful beach, is the place where the Portoviejo River merges with the sea and  is visited by many domestic and foreign tourists. Every 15 days the Hope to Overcome Credit Group meets.

Yenny lives here. She is 51 years old. She has a spouse and, from this relationship, two children who are 28 and 16. The youngest is in school. Her husband is a trader.

Yenny, along with her husband, has a business buying and selling fish, shrimp, scallops and all types of shellfish. They work every day. At sunrise, they travel to Puerto Lopez where she buys from the boats who arrive on the beach since there she can buy at the cheapest prices. Meanwhile, her husband is in charge of sales in other cities. She is in charge of selling from her house or delivering to restaurants, hotels, cevicherias and customers in her area. She has been dedicated to this work for more than 16 years and is getting ahead along with her family.

This loan will be used to buy fish, shrimp, scallops and other shellfish. She has been with the Credit Group for more than five years and she likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business. Her dreams are to keep expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, scallops and other shellfish.

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es: Celinda vive en la encantadora ciudad de Paucartambo al sur de la ciudad del Cusco, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y otros. En esta oportunidad ella requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes.
texts.en: Celinda lives in the enchanting city of Paucartambo to the south of the city of Cusco. She is an enterprising and hard working woman who is dedicated to farming, livestock and raising young animals like guinea pigs, hens, pigs and others. At this time, she needs a loan to buy guinea pigs.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Atikas

texts.en:
Atikas (pictured here), aged 50, lives in Phnom Penh suburb. She has been married since 1986 and has five sons and two daughters. Two of her children are married, two work for a factory that produces drinking water, one attends school and the other two are still young. Atikas buys and sells fruit, while her husband is a moto kangbei taxi driver. In the past, they were commonly known as "tuk tuks" (a three wheeled motorcycle taxi), but they are now officially called "moto kangbei" by government authorities.

Rokiyas wants to buy a motorcycle for her son to drive to work because they commute to work by bicycling. Taking a bicycle is tiring and takes time. Hence she decided to apply for a loan.

(Rokiyas is Cham Muslim.  The Cham are an ethnic minority in Cambodia, with a population estimated at 200,000 to 300,000 out of Cambodia's population of about 13 million people (2008).  The Cham have a proud past, with the Champa kingdom ruling much of what is present-day Vietnam from the 2nd century to 9th century. The modern history of the Cham in Cambodia is marked by tragedy, as the genocidal Khmer Rouge prioritized the extermination of Muslims, Buddhists, and others of faith during their rule from 1975 to 1979.)

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Sokun, age 42, lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. She has one son and two daughters. One of her children is a garment factory worker and the other two are at university.
  
Sokun is a garment factory worker while her husband is a construction worker. Sokun’s daughter, who is a garment factory worker, commutes to work by riding her old motorcycle. The old motorcycle does not work well and uses more gasoline.

So Sokun decided to apply for a loan in order to add to her own money to buy a new motorbike for her daughter.

loans.use: To add to her own money to buy a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Fakhra

texts.en:
Fakhra is the age of 40 years, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a cosmetics shop in which he sells beauty products of various kinds. He contributes his full income for household expenses. He always tries to establish his businesses through offering the latest cosmetics products. Nowadays, the latest cosmetics products introduced in the market are very demanding and expensive as well.

Fakhra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will give the full amount to her husband so that he can buy the latest cosmetic products such as facial cream, hair colors, makeover kits, lipstick, nail polish, etc. She hopes that this will enhance the businesses.
 
Fakhra is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy beauty products for reselling.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina, age, 38, is a responsible mother living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her fifth loan with BRAC and first with Kiva.
 
Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with the scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and sells them to the recycling factories. Nowadays, due to household expenses, he does not have enough to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell for getting money.

Therefore, Rubina has requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents in future.
 
She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap goods for reselling.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary (pictured here), age 59, lives in Phnom Penh suburb. She has two sons and three daughters. Four of her children are married and live in separate homes. And another one assists his parent in business. 
Mary and her husband are fishermen and they sell fish that they catch in the local market. Some of her fishing nets are old and breaking down. She wants to buy new ones, it would be better for Mary to work. 
Hence Mary decided to apply for a loan in order to purchase new fishing nets. 
Mary is Cham Muslim.  The Cham are an ethnic minority in Cambodia, with a population estimated at 200,000 to 300,000 out of Cambodia's population of about 13 million people (2008).  The Cham have a proud past, with the Champa kingdom ruling much of what is present-day Vietnam from the 2nd century to 9th century. The modern history of the Cham in Cambodia is marked by tragedy, as the genocidal Khmer Rouge prioritized the extermination of Muslims, Buddhists, and others of faith during their rule from 1975 to 1979.

loans.use: To buy new fishing net.

loans.name: Chheut

texts.en:
Chheut is 46 years old with five adult children, one of whom is already married. He is currently residing in Samraong village, Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. He has been in the land cultivating business and farming rice for 25 years now. Farming has been his major source of income and has covered the needs of his family.

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Chheut is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding his family's health and protecting the environment. He will use the loan he's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve his household sanitation practices for the sake of his family and to drill a pump well for daily water consumption.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve his household sanitation practices for the sake of his family and to drill a pump well for daily water consumption.

loans.name: Crisencio

texts.en:
Crisencio is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him, as he was able to buy the spare parts needed in his transportation business. His loan helped not just in his business but also in the education of his children. His income from business is assisting his everyday household expenditures. He works hard to provide for his family's everyday expenses.

He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of their Jeepney unit.  He also wants to buy some equipment for their repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Crisencio hopes that his business will continue to grow and dreams to have a good future. He meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and pay for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit.

loans.name: Jesibel

texts.en:
Jesibel is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jesibel hopes that her business will last longer and dreams of having a good future.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla previously accessed an 35,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Perla dreams of having another variety store and hopes to give her child a good education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed for her business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy previously accessed an 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household, and business expenditures. She also has a canteen and a jeepney for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Joy dreams of expansion in all her businesses and hopes that her family is always in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense.
