She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Margie hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams that her children will finish their education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 49-year-old married woman and mother of six children. 

Her son is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her son. He wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

Parveen thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy tires and do maintenance of the auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en: Nagina is a 45-year-old married woman.   She is a responsible mother living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her fifth loan with Brac and first with Kiva. She owns a small clothing business at home. She purchases clothes from the market at a low price and sells them at a high price in her community. The ladies of town like her garment collection a lot. Her family members appreciate her for her efforts. Now the summer season is going to start and she wants to buy clothes for the summer season to sell. But she does not have cash in hand, due to household expenses.  Therefore, she has requested a loan so she can buy summer season's clothing to cope with the demand. She wishes for the bright future of her children, and her dream is to provide a better education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy summer season's clothing for reselling.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is a 40-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been manufacturing bangles at home along with her husband. Her husband buys silver wire coils from the market.  Through a machine, they give it a round shape, paste pearls with glue, pack it in polythene, then sell into the market.
She has four children and she barely manages to satisfy their needs. She is required to provide them with good food, health, and education. She needs to earn sufficient income to support her family well. She is in her sixth loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan. Currently, she has requested a loan to buy more raw materials such as silver wire coils, sequins, glue for making bangles so she can increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.
Farhat is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy silver wire coils, sequins, glue for making bangles

loans.name: Arif Hussain

texts.en:
Arif Hussain is a 52-years old man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of a son and a daughter. He owns an electronics shop in which he sells televisions and LCD TVs, electrical fans, refrigerators, etc. He also offers electronics items on installments as well.  He sells types of TVs and LCD TVs, such as Sony, Samsung, LG, Nobel and Panasonic. He also offers a one-year warranty for those electronics products. He speaks with a tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his customers. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relation with his customers. That is why his business is running well and increasing day by day.
So to enhance his business, he wants to offer more electronics to his customers, but he does not have enough capital for investment. Therefore, Arif Hussain requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, the field partner of Kiva. Through this loan he will buy more electronics products to sell.
Arif Hussain is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy electronics items, such as  televisions and LCD TVs,  and electrical fans for reselling.

loans.name: Alya

texts.en:
Alya is a 39-years old lady, living along with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has grown old, but even in his old age he is doing a scrap business. He is a hawker and purchases scrap iron, plastic, waste papers, etc., from door to door. He uses his four-wheel cart to carry the goods from one place to another. Now his cart has gotten damaged, due to loading and unloading, so that he wants to repair it and change its tyres, but he does not have sufficient savings.

Therefore, Alya has requested a loan so her husband would be able to repair his four-wheel cart and buy some additional scrap goods to generate maximum income. 

Alya hopes that through the profit, she will make more savings to cope with sudden incidents in future.

loans.use: to maintain a four-wheel cart and to buy additional scrap goods.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 41-year-old lady, living with her spouse and eight children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living facilities for her children but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her two sons have been driving auto-rickshaws for many years; their income is sufficient to feed the entire family. One of her sons has to maintain the auto-rickshaw body but he does not have a sufficient amount of money to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Razia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy new body for the auto-rickshaw. She hopes that she would be able to make enough saving till the time of their marriages. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new body for her son's auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She is hardworking and independent and is helping her family by providing tailoring services at her home, which she has been doing for four years. She has a vast knowledge of the techniques of stitching. She sews garments for the nearest factories.
 
To help her continue operations of her business, Sobia requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to buy a sewing machine because her previous sewing machine no longer functions due to continuously working. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to cover personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for tailoring.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 43-year-old lady; she has been stitching clothes for the past several years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses generated income to support her entire family. Her sewing machine has become out of order, however.
 
Due to lack of savings and other funds, Yasmeen is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. For this reason, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She intends to use this loan amount to buy a new sewing machine to create a means of increasing revenue, so she may generate a healthier source of income.

Yasmeen hopes that this loan will prove positive and beneficial for herself and will be the cause for getting more income. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and five children. Her husband owns a small gemstone shop, in which he sells precious gemstones for rings, ear rings and necklace. He presents his gemstones under a display glass case for the attraction of customers.  
He has only one source of income, he has to afford the expenses of utility bills, school fees of his children and household expenses, alone. The condition of his house is not up to the mark for living.
Therefore, Rubina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s brac Pakistan, so her husband can increase the inventory and earnings as well.
She hopes that she will improve her house soon, so that her family members pass their lives comfortably.
Rubina is very thankful to the Kiva’s field partner brac Pakistan because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: to buy gemstones for reselling.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Nan (pictured here), age 49, lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. She is a widowed mother with three sons and two daughters. Four of her children are married and another one has full-time employment.  

Nan is a tailor. She wants to buy another sewing machine and materials needed in her tailoring business; that’s why she is applying for a loan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and materials needed in the tailoring business.

loans.name: Theang

texts.en:
Theang is a resident of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. He is 46 years old, married and a loving father of five children, one of whom has been settled for marriage. To feed the family, Theang grows rice and works as a paid worker for extra income. It is the business that he has been doing for ages and has been the major source of his income.

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Theang is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding his family's health and protecting the environment. He will use the loan he's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve his household sanitation practices for the sake of his family and drill a pump well for daily water consumption.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve his household sanitation practices and drill a  well for daily water consumption.

loans.name: Maisam

texts.en:
Maisam (pictured here), age 53, lives in Phnom Penh suburb. She has four sons and two daughters. Five of her children are married and another has full-time employment.  
Maisam and her husband sell dried fish. They buy fresh fish to make dried fish by themselves and sell in their local market. 
Maisam wants to buy more fish make to dried fish for sale. Hence she decided to apply for a loan. 
Maisam is Cham Muslim.  The Cham are an ethnic minority in Cambodia, with a population estimated at 200,000 to 300,000 out of Cambodia's population of about 13 million people (2008).  The Cham have a proud past, with the Champa kingdom ruling much of what is present-day Vietnam from the 2nd century to 9th century. The modern history of the Cham in Cambodia is marked by tragedy, as the genocidal Khmer Rouge prioritized the extermination of Muslims, Buddhists, and others of faith during their rule from 1975 to 1979.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to make dried fish for sale.

loans.name: Sok Y

texts.en:
Sok Y (pictured here) is 62 years old and lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. She has one son and three daughters. Three of her children are married and live in separate homes, and another one is an auto repairman. Her husband is a security guard.

Sok Y sells grocery items from home. Additionally, she also rents out a space of her house and gets paid with monthly fees. 

Sok Y wants expand her grocery inventory, so she applied for a loan to purchase grocery items.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store by buying more grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy the spare parts and accessories needed in her transportation business. Her loan helped not just in her business, but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting in her everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for a new 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of the Jeepney* unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Eufemia dreams to continuously expand her business and hopes to have a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship members** every week to share stories of her work and to find strength and encouragement from the word of God, which she studies.

* Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater Jeepney. It is open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy enough for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the Jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, accessories and maintenance on her Jeepney unit.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes previously accessed a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of the Jeepney* unit. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 15,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of the Jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Lourdes dreams to have another unit of Jeepney and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their lives and business every week. There, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. Jeeps were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipinos, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and with their ingenuity they modified the Jeep into a 20-seat Jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every-day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the Jeepneys are one of the things that make the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay down their microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her Jeepney.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 30-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health expenses.
Asma wants to grow the business of her husband.  This is the reason she has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, Brac Pakistan, so he can buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She is an honest and regular client of Brac Pakistan.  She is in her fourth loan cycle with good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva field partner, Brac

loans.use: to buy inventories for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.en:
Nicanor previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his child and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help cover their daily needs and the educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Nicanor dreams that his business will be durable and that he will have other sources of income. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: M. Saqib

texts.en:
M. Saqib is a very hard-working borrower with Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He is 34 years old and lives in Lahore with his family: a decent and responsible spouse, a son, and a daughter. Since 2004, M. Saqib has been running a small garment shop in the market. This shop is the only source of income for his family. He sells ready-made garments such as cotton shirts, pants, T-shirts, trousers, jeans, etc. according to the seasonal requirement. 

The spring season has started in Pakistan, so he wants to purchase a variety of seasonal clothing, such as cotton shirts, pants, T-shirts, trousers, etc. To do this, he has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. The loan will help him to offer a variety of products to his clients and increase his net income as well. M. Saqib dreams of increasing his business so that his children can have a better future. M. Saqib's family sends loads of prayers and thanks to all of the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothing such as cotton shirts, pants, T-shirts, trousers, etc.  for reselling.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is aged 34, living in Lahore, with her husband and three children. Her husband newly started a barber shop; he wants to set up his shop by purchasing new plastic furniture and instruments but due to financial constraints; he is unable to buy these things.
 
Due to his low purchasing power, Sumaira has requested a loan so her husband can be empowered and can easily buy new instruments such as scissors, combs, a shaving machine, front mirror and plastic furniture.

She hopes that this loan will work positively and she will be able to put aside some savings for household expenses. Sumaira thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To set up a newly opened barber shop.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a 43-year-old woman living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw which did not belong to him. With the help of savings, he wants to buy a used auto rickshaw. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a used rickshaw. He wants to start driving but is looking for a lump sum amount.  Therefore, Naseem has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy a rickshaw and can drive the rickshaw happily. She hopes that now her husband will be able to generate constant income. Naseem is very happy after receiving this loan.  She thanks Kiva and field partner, bBac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a used rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Seang (pictured here), age 34, lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. He has been married since 2000 and has one son and two daughters. Two of his children attend school and the other one is still too young. 

Seang’s wife stays at home and does house work. That’s why their main source of income is from his business. Seang is a moto kangbei taxi driver. In the past, they were commonly known as "tuk tuks" (a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi), but they are now officially called "moto kangbei" by government authorities.

Seang wants to buy a washing machine, as it would be easier for his wife. Hence he decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: To buy a washing machine for family use.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Narantsetseg, 37 years old, lives with her two children in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. She has been running a grocery store since 2012. Her husband passed away years ago. She used to run a flour mill together with her husband. 

Now she is requesting a loan of $1,700 USD to buy land so that she can build her second grocery store on her new land. The grocery store is the life source of her family, and she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy land to build a second grocery store

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda previously accessed a 35,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for a new 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Luzviminda hopes to continuously expand her business and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week, and it is where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sroan

texts.en:
Sroan is a resident from Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She is married and has eight children. Sroan is a farmer and has been working in agriculture for more than 20 years. She primarily grows rice and other seasonal crops as her major source of income.

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Sroan is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding her family's health and protecting the environment. She will use the loan she's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family, and also will use the remaining funds to drill a pump well and build water storage.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.name: Hyam 4 Group

texts.en:
The Hyam 4 is a group that consists of four hard-working women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They have requested a group loan of 120,000 YER and will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment.
Hyam is a very active woman from a poor family.   She is a 34 year-old married woman with three children. She is the leader of the group. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. Recently, he became unable to take care of the family. Hyam decided to assume the responsibility of the family. She wants to provide her family with necessary needs.
In 2010, Hyam started her business as a door-to-door saleswoman selling women's and children's clothes for the local residents in her area. She earns good profits, but most of what she earns goes to the expenses of the family. On other side, Hyam wants to enlarge her business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB. She will use her loan in order to expand her business through purchasing new stylish clothes and reselling them to the customers in her area.
Hyam hopes to expand her business through buying all kinds of clothes and opening a clothing store in her area. She wants to provide her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: To purchase new stylish clothes and resell them to the customers in her area.

loans.name: Zynab Al-Mater Group

texts.en:
This group is called Zynab Al-Mater. and is composed of four members. All the members are females living in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 170,000 YER from AMB. 

The president of the group is Zynab. She is 33 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Sana'a, Yemen.  Her oldest child is seven years old and the youngest one is three years old. Zynab works as a housewife, and she is very active lady. Her husband inherited the house from his father, but it is very old and needs to a quick renovation. It will fall down at any time. The family needs a lot of money to renovate the house. Unfortunately, they don’t have the enough money to do that. For this reason, Zynab applied for a loan of 50, 000 YER. She will use the loan to buy construction materials to renovate the house.

Zynab looks forward to renovating all her house. In the future, she hopes to open a small business that will help her in provide her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to renovate the house.

loans.name: Al-Kifah Al-Sallah Group

texts.en:
Al-Kifah Al-Sallah is a group that consists of four women living in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 220,000 YER from AL- Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB). 

 Iftikher is a 30-year-old married woman.  She is the leader of the group. Iftikher lives with her spouse in their own house. She is an uneducated woman, but she is very dynamic. Many years ago, her husband bought a piece of land and built a house on it. This business cost him a lot of money. He finished the construction of the first floor, but it needs renovation. Iftikher's husband became unable to renovate the house. For this reason, Iftikher decided to help him in the expenses of the renovation. Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to do that. As a result, Iftikher is requesting a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials, such as cement and paints, in order to finish all the renovation of the house.
 
 Iftikher's dream in the future is completing the building of the second floor and renovating it. She hopes to provide her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials as cement and paints in order to finish all the renovation of the house.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is the age of 30. She is living with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a milkman by profession; he sells milk from his shop to the common people. His customers like the fresh and delicious milk he sells. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs because there are too many competitors in the market.

Due to quality and reasonable rates, most of the customers like to buy milk from him. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis and wants to buy milk in bulk, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy milk in a large quantity.

Therefore, Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy more milk to sell and produce yogurt, cheese and butter.
 
Yasmeen is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy milk for reselling and for the production of yogurt, cheese and butter.

loans.name: Makin Group

texts.en:
This group is called Makin. It is comprised of three women. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. This community is hard-working and they work as much as they can in order to improve their living conditions. They took out a loan of 110,000 YER from AMB.

Khadijah is the leader of the group. She is 32 years old. She has seven children and lives with them in a poor family. Her oldest child is 14 years old and the youngest one is 9 years old. She is a hardworking woman who dreams of providing her children with a better future. Her husband was an employee and his salary was good enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Now, he is a pensioner, and he became unable to take care of his children. He was the sole breadwinner of the family. For this reason, Khadijah decided to assume the responsibility for the family. She started her business selling accessories, makeup, and cosmetics three years ago. 

Khadijah wants to enlarge her business, but she doesn't have enough money. As a result, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more accessories and resell them to her customers. She looks forward to becoming a professional cosmetologist in the future. Her dream is opening a beauty salon. She hopes to provide her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: To purchase more accessories and cosmetics and resell them to her customers.

loans.name: Hayati Group

texts.en:
The Hayati Group consists of three women who have requested a loan from AMB for 150,000 YER. 

Susan is 27 years old and single. She lives with her family in Sana'a, Yemen. She is the group's leader and is responsible for them. Susan is a university graduate and works in a private school. After she finishes her work in the school, Susan returns to her house and wants to watch TV programs and news. Unfortunately, the TV is very old and is not very good to watch. Susan wants to purchase a new TV, but she does not have enough money to do so as she spends most of her salary on her parents' expenses.  For this reason, she requested a loan from AMB for 50,000 YER, which she will use to buy new TV for her house. 

In the future, Susan hopes to open her own business that will assist her in providing her family with an increased income. She also hopes to open a saving account with AMB.

loans.use: to purchase a new TV

loans.name: Om -Rashid Group

texts.en:
This group of four women is called Om-Rashid. They all live in simple families in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Halima is a 34-year-old married woman with five children. She is the leader of the group. Halima lives with her family in their own house. She is an uneducated woman, but she is very dynamic and vigorous. She works as a housewife. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family, and he works hard to improve the condition of his family. From his business, he could buy a piece of land and build the house on it. Little by little, he completed the building of the first floor, which cost him a lot of money. Now he needs to buy doors and windows to complete the renovation, however Halima and her husband don't have enough money to do so. For this reason, Halima applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase windows and doors to finish the renovation and prepare her house for residence.

Halima's dream for the future is to renovate all of the house in order to move from the rented house to their own house and live inside of it. She hopes to save the money that she pays for the rented house. This money will help her improve the condition of the family.

loans.use: To purchase windows and doors to finish the renovation and prepare her house for residence.

loans.name: Nail

texts.en:
Nail is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  He is a refugee living in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper and educates children.   He earns money raising and selling seasonal fruits, such as apples, cherries, and pears, at a local bazaar, which he has been doing for eight years. Fruit growing is much expanded in Azerbaijan because people have a high demand for fruits. They like to eat them fresh or to use in order to prepare fruit juice, jam, and fruit cakes. Nail's monthly income is 200 AZN. He earns additional income working in a tea café. 

Nail’s income does not cover his family’s demands. He requested his third loan for 1,200 AZN, which he will use to purchase good fertilizers and repair his garden.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to repair his garden

loans.name: Muftaram

texts.en: Muftaram lives in a rural area, far from the center of the region. She is a careful mother of two children. Muftaram is married. Her husband has a small income, so her family has poor living conditions. Six months ago, Muftaram began her own business with animal husbandry because her family needs additional income. Muftaram feeds five cows. She feeds the cows in a cowshed at her home. Her husband helps her to manage the business. She plans to increase the working capital of her new business in order to develop it. She is asking for a loan of 13,000 TJS to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Chimnaz

texts.en:
Chimnaz is 58 years old, married, and has two daughters and two sons. The members of the family are refugees and live in an IDP (internally displaced persons) settlement. Her husband is a laborer. Chimnaz has been working as a farmer for 30 years. She raises sheep and cows, and then sells meat, milk, and sheep wool at a local bazaar. Her monthly income is 220 AZN.

Cattle breeding is one of the most prevalent parts of farming. People breed sheep, cows, etc. Then they sell milk and meat at local bazaars for big markets or restaurants. 

Chimnaz doesn’t earn enough money and can’t cover her living expenses. She applied for 1500 AZN in order to buy additional cattle to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle

loans.name: Sobia's Group

texts.en:
Sobia is a 23-year-old married woman living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a milkman by profession; he sells milk at his shop in the community and earns a reasonable income for his family. He has been purchasing milk from the market and selling it as a retailer from his shop. Nowadays, customers are complaining about the freshness of the milk. He wants to buy fresh milk from a wholesaler, but their price is higher than the market prices. He does not have enough cash in hand to buy fresh milk, but he also does not want to compromise on the quality of the milk he sells. 

Therefore, Sobia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can purchase fresh milk from the field to sell. She hopes that she will be able to save some of the profits from the loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh milk for reselling.

loans.name: M. Arshad

texts.en:
M. Arshad is 29 years old, married and an energetic man living with his spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He owns a general store in which he sells shampoo, bath soaps, detergents, biscuits, jams, cold drinks, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well. Some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with a monotonous tone that is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. 

His general store is very famous in the town; that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, M. Arshad requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to buy more stock such as  shampoo, bath soaps, detergents, biscuits, jams, cold drinks, etc., for his general store. He hopes that lenders will support him, and that this loan will prove productive for his business as well. 

He is very impressed with the Kiva loan cycle system; he is thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as shampoo, bath soaps, detergents, biscuits, jams, cold drinks, etc., for the general store.

loans.name: Saveunn

texts.en:
Saveunn is 50 years old with four adult children. Saveunn is presently residing in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She has been working in agriculture, farming rice for nearly 35 years now. Farming is the significant income source, and she can earn additional income by retailing mixed products at home.

Saveunn is now taking out a loan in the amount of $700 to buy stock of merchandise like sweets, biscuits, shampoos, soft drinks, groceries and other miscellaneous household items for her business. Saveunn hopes this will result in improving her income to ensure food security for her household.

loans.use: to buy stock of merchandise like sweets, biscuits, shampoos, soft drinks, groceries and other miscellaneous household items for her business.

loans.name: Thef Allah Group

texts.en:
Thef Allah is a group consisting of four women, living in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB). 

Katiba is a 52-year-old married woman with three children. She is the leader of the group. Katiba is an uneducated woman and works as a housewife. She lives with her family in their own house. Many years ago, Katiba and her husband accumulated a good amount of money, and then they decided to buy a piece of land and build a house on it. Recently, they finished the construction of the first floor, but it needs to be painted and renovated. Katiba and her husband have spent a lot of money on this project. Unfortunately, they haven't been able to complete this project. They need financial support in order to finish the renovation of the house. Therefore, Katiba applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase paint to renovate the house.

Katiba dream in the future is finishing the second floor and renovating it.  She is thankful to anyone who can help her in completing the construction of the house.

loans.use: To purchase paint to renovate the house.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.en:
The member Cesar Augusto belongs to the "Las Mercedes de Katañiray" communal bank. He continues earning his living providing taxi services. He has been working in this business for quite a while, and it is going well for him thanks to the hard work he puts into his business every day. He would like to continue working so that he can get ahead.

Cesar Augusto is requesting the loan to perform maintenance on his car, such as changing the oil. He feels grateful for the loan granted and he promises to repay his loan according to its established terms.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his car, such as an oil change.

loans.name: Salmah Group

texts.en:
Fatima is the featured borrower of Salmah group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, because they have always been neighbors and friends. 

Fatima is an 18-year-old, single woman, the sole breadwinner to five members of her family. Eight months ago, Fatima started selling mobile phone prepaid cards and six months earlier, she started selling women's accessories to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

Fatima learned the accessories business from her aunt who works, selling women's accessories and needs. Fatima is working hard to develop this business as much as she can, to increase her business capital and attract new customers. 

For this reason, Fatima is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to increase her business merchandise with a newly-released accessories collection that will develop her business, especially the spring and summer collection.

In the beginning, Fatima had obstacles in marketing and promoting her products, but now she is well-known in her region and she is working hard to participate in several exhibitions that will help her to be introduced to more customers from different regions. Fatima is working hard to open her own accessories-selling shop in the future, to move her business from her home and to develop her living conditions.

Fatima is the woman at the far right side of the picture. As for the other group members, Salma is in the middle, and Sanaa is on the left.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a newly-released accessories collection.

loans.name: Kawkab Group

texts.en:
Kawkab is a group which is composed of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.

Kawkab is the leader of the group. She is a 30-year-old married woman with five children. She is an uneducated woman, but she works hard inside her house. She works as a housewife. Kawkab says that her house lacks many home appliances, and she can't afford them.  Inside the kitchen of her house, Kawkab keeps many kinds of drinks and sweets. But she doesn't have a refrigerator to keep all the drinks and foods inside it. As a result, most of the food and drinks expire quickly. So, she has to put them in the litter bin. For this reason, Kawkab is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a refrigerator to keep the foods and drinks cold in the house. 

Kawkab looks forward to opening her own business that will help her in covering the expenses of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator to keep foods and drinks cold in the house.

loans.name: Ibrahim Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ibrahim. It comprises four women. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. This community is hardworking, and they work as much as they can in order to improve their living conditions. They took out a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Samah is the leader of the group. She is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She lives with her children in their own house in Sana'a, Yemen. She is a hardworking woman who dreams of providing her children with a better future. Unfortunately, living in this country presents many challenges. One of these challenges is the lack of electricity. Most of the people live in darkness most nights around the country. The electricity crisis is one of the biggest problems in Yemen, especially since the (2011) revolution. For this reason, Samah applied for a loan from AMB in order to purchase a power generator for the house in order to generate good light.

Samah looks forward to improving the living standards of her family. She hopes for stability in the situation in her country.

loans.use: To purchase a power generator for the house in order to generate good light.

loans.name: Razia

texts.ru: Разия, 67 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей. У Разии- высшее педагогическое образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав 4 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Разии, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок и 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Разия обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Разия планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Razia is 67, a widow, and the mother of three children. She has a higher education in pedagogy and works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began four years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has one milking cow, one calf and 10 sheep, with a monthly income of about 15,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Razia has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase sheep for fattening and resale at the market for a higher price. She plans to use profits from the loan to further increase the size of her herd.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Kesa

texts.en: Kesa is 36 years old and lives in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has two children who are in school. Kesa stays at home and does housework. The family's main source of income is from her husband’s salary, who works in a government office. Kesa wants to buy a motorcycle for her children to drive to school, so she has decided to request for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is a thirty-two-year-old married mother of three children. A year ago, she established her current convenience store, to support her husband. Her shop is developing gradually, and she is working hard to keep meeting her customers' needs. Zahraa is a hard worker who puts a lot of effort into providing her family with the necessary standard of living.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's school tuition fees. With the income from her business, she will help her husband pay for his car's official registration. He needs this to keep his work, since he works in gathering scrap and the car is a must. 

Zahraa is willing to open a new branch in the future, to increase her income. In future, she hopes to improve her living standards and make sure that she'll be capable of covering her children's future university needs.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun (pictured here) lives in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has four sons and two daughters. Three of her children are married and separated from home. One is a driver, another attends school, and another is still young.  

Oun stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s business. Her husband is a fisherman and a construction worker. 

Oun wants to buy a motorcycle for her son, who is a driver, to drive to work. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 34 years old, married and blessed with 2 children that he supports. He has been running a retail shop for the last 4 years, where he gets a monthly income of KES 20000. With a loan of KES 20000 from VisionFund, he plans to restock his shop with a variety of consumable products.
The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into his business for expansion. David's future dream is to be successful in life and in his business as well as being able to support his family with ease.

loans.use: to restock his retail shop

loans.name: 04 Trường Thi Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhiệm works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase pigs and chickens to raise and resell in the future.

Nhiệm is fifty-nine years old and married with two children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 11-06-04 Trường Thi solidarity group. Nhiệm supports no dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nhiệm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Nhiệm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Nhiệm hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and chickens to raise and resell in the future.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick used the previous loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, etc. to use in his farm. His farm is doing well.

Patrick has applied for his second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him buy more seedlings and fertilizer to use on his farm. He hopes to use the profits to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to own a herd of cattle in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a Master's in Business Administration

loans.name: Dilia María

texts.es:
En el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y además visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Esperanza Para  Superar.
En este lugar vive la señora Dilia, tiene 54 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, con ellos vive una de sus hijas la tiene capacidades especiales. El marido no trabaja por enfermedad. 
Doña Dilia es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para salir adelante y mucho mas después de que ya su marido no puede trabajar, ella para ganarse la vida desde hace mas de 30 años empezó con un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde vende tostadas, batidos de frutas, sodas, hamburguesas, papas fritas, hot dog, energizantes, hielos, y otras bebidas, también tienen una carreta en la cual van a vender junto con su marido que siempre le ayuda, esto lo hacen los fines de semana y en feriados que es cuando más turistas llegan. Así ellos salen adelante con un trabajo horado y digno.
Este crédito es para comprar sodas, frutas, pan y otros víveres necesarios en su negocio. Esta mas de 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, in the seaside town of San Jacinto, near a beautiful beach where Portoviejo River meets the sea and is highly visited by many national and international tourists, Grupo De Crédito Esperanza Para  Superar or the Hope to Improve Loan Group meets.
Dilia lives in this place. She is 54 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which she has three children older in age. Her daughter with special needs lives with them. Her husband cannot work due to illness.
Dilia is a woman that has always liked to work to move forward in life and more so after her husband wasn't able to work. For a living, more than 30 years ago, she started a business selling fast food. She has small shop in her home where she sells tostadas, smoothies, sodas, hamburgers, french fries, hot dogs, energy drinks, ice cream and other drinks. They also have a cart with which she sells together with her husband that always helps. She does it on weekends and on holidays when more tourists come. In this way they are moving forward in life with hard work and dignity.
This loan is to buy sodas, fruit, bread and other groceries necessary in the business. She has been in the Loan Group for more than 6 years and likes the financial loans for her business. Her dream is to have a large restaurant.

loans.use: to buy soda, fruit, bread and other groceries.

loans.name: Claudia Del Rocio

texts.es:
En el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y además visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Esperanza Para  Superar.
En este lugar vive la señora Claudia, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad, la mayor estudia en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
Doña Claudia es una gran esposa que realiza los créditos para ayudarle a su marido en su negocio, él vende materiales de pesca en su casa, vende redes, anzuelos, piolas, plomos, arpones,  entre  otras muchas cosas que se requieren para realizar una buena pesca, trabaja todos los días de la semana y su forma es ofrecer sus productos a los pescadores una vez que llegan de alta mar, cada quince días viaja hasta el centro de Manta a comprar lo necesario para que cuando lleguen sus clientes tener de todo para ellos, lleva 2 años en  esta actividad y le va muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes.
Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, anzuelos, grapas, entre otros productos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 años  y le gusta porque con los créditos le ayuda a su marido. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the beautiful beach town of San Jacinto, which is flanked by a lovely beach where the Portoviejo River meets the sea and is visited by many domestic and international tourists, the "Esperanza Para Superar" communal bank gathers twice a month.

In this place lives Claudia. She is 29 years old and in a common-law marriage from which she has two children who are six and two years old; the elder is in school. Her husband is a merchant.

Doña Claudia is a great wife who takes out loans to help her husband in his business. He sells fishing materials from their house. He sells nets, hooks, lines, weights, harpoons, and many other things that are needed for successful fishing. He works every day of the week and his method is to offer his products to the fishermen when they return from the open sea. Twice a month, he travels to the center of Manta to buy what he needs so that when his customers arrive, he will have everything for them. He has been in this business for two years and it is going very well; he has many customers. 

This loan is for buying nets, lines, hooks, snaps, and other products. Claudia has been in this communal bank for two years; she likes it because she helps her husband with the loans. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy nets, lines, hooks, snaps, and other fishing products.

loans.name: Safwan Al- Omeri Group

texts.en:
This group of six women is called Safwan Al-Omeri. They all live in traditional and simples families in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 230,000 YER from AMB. 

Wadia is a 30-year-old married woman living with her spouse in their own house. She is the leader of the group. She has a diploma certificate, but she couldn't find a job in order to improve the living condition of her family. She works as a housewife, and she is very dynamic and vigorous. Her husband accumulated a good amount of money from his work and purchased a piece of land. Wadia supported him with a lot of her money. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to cover all the necessary needs of the house. Year by year, they built their own house on that piece of land. This cost them a lot of money, but they finished the building of the house. However, they need financial support in order to prepare the house for residence. As a result, Wadia is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase doors and windows to complete the renovation of their house.
 
Wadia's dream for the future is to renovate further and build more one floor. She hopes to save the money which she pays for rent by moving into their own house. She thinks this amount of money will help her to improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: To purchase doors and windows to complete the renovation of their house.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 31 years old and single. He recently began operating his own Zoona mobile money transfer business. Prior to that, he worked as a teller in one of the busiest Zoona mobile money transfer shops in Chililabombwe. He enjoyed working as a teller and worked  diligently for five years learning the ins and outs of the business. Through time, James developed an interest in opening his own Zoona mobile money transfer business and received permission from his manager to start running his own outlet in the nearby city of Kitwe.

James is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase a trading booth. This loan will enable him to serve more customers as the booth will be in a good location and will attract more customers. James will earn increased profits and provide him with the ability to expand his business. James is confident that as his business grows and becomes more profitable, he will be able to spend some of his profits on furthering his own education.

loans.use: to purchase a trading booth

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.en:
Dilfuza is a young and hardworking woman. She is single and lives with her parents. Dilfuza always has wanted to be a business lady. She realized her dream six months ago when she started a new business in sewing. Dilfuza sews women's clothes in the national style. She services her clients in her house, where she has a workshop. Dilfuza tries to deliver these services to a high standard, so she can attract more clients. 

She is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS to buy an embroidery machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar dreams of having a car that will be used in her hog-raising business. She is 42 years of age, married, and has three children. 

Pilar has been 10 years in managing the business and still enjoys running the business. Through her sales from the business, Pilar is able to finance their needs in the farming business. She wanted to expand the business and further sustain their farming business. 

Pilar wishes for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. She hopes that someday her dreams will come true so that she will no longer hire transportation just to sell her hogs to the butcher.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Odessa

texts.en:
Odessa always hopes for the growth of her retailing business which is selling grocery items in their village. Odessa is 44 years old, married, and blessed with four children, all of whom are already married. Her husband works as a construction worker. Odessa and her husband income can satisfy their basic needs like their daily food, but she wanted to have an extra income to have savings.

With regards to her business, Odessa is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy drinks, biscuits, soap, shampoo, and many more items. The loan will help her increase her sales and income as well. She will prioritize to save some of her profits while others will be used to support some basic needs of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy drinks, biscuits, soap, shampoo, and many more items to resell.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is in her thirties, married and has one child at school. She decided to manage a hog-raising business with her husband. They decided on this type of business because the money they make from selling the hogs can be reinvested into their farming business. Janice has been six years in the business and hopes it will last as it is her source of income. 

Janice is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs. Giving the right amount of feed and vitamins to her hogs will help the hogs grow faster and healthily. She will save some of her earnings for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Taing Or

texts.en:
Taing Or is forty-four years old and married to a humble farmer, who is also a father of three school-going children. They live in the rural community of Prey Chhor district, where they operate a farming business to sustain their family’s income. Despite their financial hardship, she and her husband aim to educate their children and give them a better life.

Taing Or is taking a loan in the amount of USD 750 to buy a motorcycle to fulfil the family’s transportation needs. This way she can prevent her family members from paying for daily taxi services and save more for future family needs. Taing is very grateful to all lenders for their support in this loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to fulfill the family’s transportation needs.

loans.name: Sherry Ann

texts.en:
Sherry Ann is 22 years old, married, and has one child. While her child is still young, Sherry Ann is engaged in the hog raising business in their village. She started her business when she requested her first loan. Since she is new in the business, Sherry Ann wishes to expand as it becomes her source of income. 

Sherry Ann requested a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. She believes that the loan will help her expand her business for the future of her child.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold and business expenditures.
She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at her store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
Helen dreams to continuously expand her business and hopes that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more chicken and pork to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to pay for more chicken and pork that she needs in her business. More items to sell will result for better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maria dreams that her business will run smoothly and hopes to have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for chicken and pork for her business.

loans.name: Coop Cocurimu G1 2014 B Group

texts.en:
Eugenie is 42 years old, married, and has two children, who attend school. She has spent five years in rice production and she is very successful with her fellow group members from the harvest. She requested a loan, which she will use to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.  She plans to use the profits to reinvest in rice farming for better outcomes. Eugenie holds a red file as sign that she is the group leader.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Savoeun (shown in photo) is 55 years old. He lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, capital city of Cambodia. He has four sons and one daughter.  

Savoeun is a barber. His wife is hired by a villager to farm and she gets paid a fee. 

Savoeun wants to build a concrete brick room under his wooden house; it would be easier for him to store things or sleep. So he decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: To build a concrete brick room under his wooden house.

loans.name: 4Th Of February Group

texts.en:
This group of women, who call themselves the 4th of February, are entering their second loan cycle with Namaste.  They all live in Sumpango, Sacatepéquez, Guatemala. During the first nine-month cycle there were twelve women entrepreneurs.  By the end of the nine months the women had paid off the loan from their first business cycle. Now seven of them are going on to a second nine-month cycle.  They all have businesses in the food sector, such as selling vegetables, fruit, lunches and snacks.
Urda (first from left) is 40 years old and married with one grown daughter. She is illiterate. Her husband helps support the family by working as a bus driver. Urda’s business is selling snacks and lunches. She is very greatful to Namaste for teaching her how to run her business and how to grow it. With her daughter’s help she now has good business records. From her Namaste business advisor she has learned how to control her expenses and improve the way she presents her products.  During the first business cycle she used part of her loan to acquire a new stove. This allowed her to increase her earnings just by adding the sale of tortillas.  
With her second cycle loan she wants to purchase products for her inventory that she now does not carry but for which there is demand. She also wants to continue improving the physical business environment, with the goal of eventually converting the space into a restaurant.  In this restaurant she would like to serve the favorite dishes of the people in her community.
During the first cycle she increased her sales by 33% and she hopes for another 24% increase during this nine month cycle.

loans.use: to purchase products for her inventory that she now does not carry but for which there is demand

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a newly married tailor. He has been in the clothing business for the last three years earning a monthly income of KES 20000. John learnt about VisionFund from a bill board in his town. He has borrowed a first loan of KES 30000 from VisionFund, which he intends to purchase more fabrics for his business. The anticipated profit will be used to cater for his young family's basic needs. John dream is to raise a successful family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for dressmaking

loans.name: Johan Antonio

texts.es:
En el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y además visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Esperanza Para  Superar.
En este lugar vive don Johan, tiene  29 años de edad, está separado y de esa relación tiene tres hijos que estudian en la escuela, ellos viven con la mamá. 
El señor Johan es un hombre que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para salir adelante, él desde hace mas de 12 años se dedica al comercio, empezó con la compra y venta de mariscos negocio que tiene en la actualidad, después y con la ayuda de los créditos surtió una tienda de víveres en su casa donde vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otros, el allí también distribuye los mariscos ya sea al por mayor o por libras, también sale a entregar los mariscos a domicilio o a los comerciantes minoristas.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en la compra de víveres para surtir más su tienda y mariscos para la venta. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con el crédito pudo surtir su tienda. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The lovely resort town of San Jacinto, where the Rio Portoviejo meets the sea, is surrounded by beautiful beaches and visited by lots of domestic and international tourists.  Every fifteen days the "Esperanza Para Superar" communal bank meets.  

Johan is a man who has always liked working to succeed.  He's been in business for more than 12 years.  He started out buying and selling seafood, a business he still has.  Later on, with help from loans, he stocked up a grocery store in his house, where he sells products like rice, sugar, oils, detergents, etc..  He also sells seafood there, both wholesale and by the pound.  In addition, he goes out to deliver seafood to homes and retail stores.  

Johan plans to use this loan to purchase supplies to further stock up his store and buy seafood to sell.  He's been through four loan cycles in his communal bank and he likes it because the loans have allowed him to stock his store.  He goals are to keep getting ahead with his business and for his store to grow more every day.

loans.use: to buy supplies and seafood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his own motorcycle.

loans.name: Chanthim

texts.en:
Chanthim is 34 years old and is married with three children, two of whom are still in school. She and her family live in a small village of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she has been growing rice for almost 20 years, earning about 8,000 KHR per day.

Chanthim has been with Hattha Kaksekar for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is asking for a new loan which is used to pay for the land she has rented for farming rice. Through this, Chanthim will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yields.

loans.use: to pay for the land she has rented for farming rice.

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es:
Por las venas de Sara corre sangre de mujer audaz, enérgica y perseverante. Desde pequeña se ha caracterizado por ser una joven luchadora. Aspiraba a ser una excelente doctora, pero por escasos recursos económicos optó por la carrera de enfermería, con el propósito de estar  involucrada en el ramo de la medicina. 
A pesar de vivir en humildes condiciones, siempre ha mantenido su hogar limpio e impecable. Sin embargo, hay una parte de su casa la cual necesita reestructurar completamente,  y esa área es la de los  servicios higiénicos. Sara desea  darle una mejor estética ya que el baño es la carta de presentación de toda vivienda. Ella solicitó un financiamiento en KIVA MiCrédito  para remodelación de su servicio higiénico, de esa forma lucirá presentable y aseado.
texts.en:
The blood of a bold, energetic, and persevering woman runs through Sara's veins. Ever since she was little, she's been known for being a feisty young woman. She aspired to be an excellent doctor, but due to scant economic resources she opted for a career as a nurse, in order to be involved in the field of medicine.

Despite living in humble conditions, she has always maintained a clean and spotless home. However, there is one area of her house which needs a complete renovation, and that area is the bathroom. Sara wants to give it a better look since the bathroom is the letter of introduction to every home. She requested a KIVA MiCrédito loan to remodel her bathroom so it will look neat and presentable.

loans.use: to remodel her bathroom

loans.name: Khanoglan

texts.en:
Khanoglan is a 41-year-old, married refugee, with a daughter and a son. His wife is a housekeeper and educates children. The family lives in an IDP settlement and the main source of the family’s income is gardening. Khanoglan has been raising and selling seasonal fruits (apples, peaches, pears, etc.) for 18 years. Sometimes, in his free time, he gets additional earnings, working as a taxi driver.

Fruit is very popular in Azerbaijan because people like to eat fresh fruit or use them to prepare tasty juice, jam for tea, and fruit pies. People prefer to buy fruit from private gardens because products there are always fresh, tasty, and cheap.

Khanoglan needs money to cover his family’s demands and children’s education. He applied for a loan of AZN 1,200 in order to buy good garden tools and fertilizer, to increase income from his garden.

loans.use: to buy good garden tools and fertilizer.

loans.name: Synat

texts.en:
Synat is a 27-year-old married woman with three little children. Syan is a housewife and helps her husband in managing their farm. The business location is not far from their home, just a 10 minutes walk. Rice cultivation is a very popular for local people and Synat’s family. She has been doing farming for over 10 years, earning a decent income for her family.
 
Synat has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, Hattha Kaksekar, to buy a motorcycle for personal use. This way she can prevent her family members from paying for daily taxi service while going to their desired directions and save more for the future emergencies. Synat thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for personal use.

loans.name: Henrry Nicolas

texts.es:
Frescura y encanto es lo que se siente en el ambiente al entrar a la panadería de Henry, quien en cinco años ha desarrollado una técnica exquisita para hacer el mejor pan que el paladar tendrá el gusto de probar. Él tiene 37 años de edad, está casado y tiene tres hijos. Es un hombre luchador, inicio en el negocio del pan desde los 22 años, cuando lo vendía por medio de un triciclo, poco a poco ha salido adelante. Su esposa es su mano derecha, juntos luchan por brindarle un futuro prosperó a sus hijos.
Henry solicita el crédito para aumentar el capital de su producción, requiere comprar  harina, levadura, manteca, entre otros productos. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento que brinda Kiva y Micrédito, puesto que serán su principal soporte para seguir progresando y expandiendo su negocio. Anhela que la clientela aumente, puesto que es su única fuente de ingreso. Es un hombre con metas e ideales, uno de sus sueños es comprar máquinas modernas para mejorar la calidad y aumentar la producción.
texts.en:
Freshness and charm are what you feel in the air when you enter Henry's bakery.  In five years he has developed exquisite technique for making the best bread you could ever taste.  Henry is 37, married, and has three children.  He's a tenacious man who started his bakery 22 years ago, selling from his three-wheeled cart.  He has gotten ahead little by little.  His wife is his right hand and together they fight to bring their children a prosperous future.

Henry is seeking a loan to increase working capital.  He needs to buy flour, yeast, butter, and other items.  He places his confidence in the Kiva and MiCrédito loans, given that they'll be his primary support for continuing to grow and improve his business.  He dreams that his clientele will expand because they are his only source of income.  He's a man of goals and ideals; one of his dreams is to buy modern equipment to improve quality and increase production.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, butter, and other products.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
La pulpería de doña Cándida es sin duda un gran alivio para sus clientes, pues en ella pueden encontrar varios productos básicos para el hogar. Tiene 52 años de edad, está soltera y tiene dos hijos. Es una mujer emprendedora y carismática, inicio su pulpería hace cuatro años, con una pequeña inversión de sus ahorros. Su negocio era una pequeña venta, donde no había mucha variedad. Hoy es una pulpería, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, al mismo tiempo agradece el apoyo de sus hijos.
Ella solicita el crédito para aumentar el capital de su producción, requiere comprar granos básicos, tales como arroz y frijoles, al mismo tiempo aceite, dulces, productos de limpieza entre otros. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que anhela seguir expandiendo su negocio, para lograr estabilidad económica, de manera que pueda asegurarse un futuro tranquilo y sin preocupación. Mientras tanto, su amabilidad y disponibilidad, seguirá haciendo de la compra de sus clientes un buen momento del día.
texts.en:
Cándida's small store is a comfort for her customers as they can find the various basic products they need for their home. She is 52 years old, single and has two children. She is entrepreneurial and charismatic. She started her store 4 years ago with a small investment from her savings. Her business was small with little variety.

Today it is a small store thanks to her effort and dedication and at the same time she is grateful for the help from her children. She is requesting a loan to increase the capital of her business. She needs to buy basic food items like rice and beans as well as oil, sweets, cleaning products, etc. She is putting her faith in the loan as she hopes to continue to expand her business. She wants to establish an economic stability to assure a peaceful, worry-free future. Meanwhile she will continue her work with her clients with friendliness and willing to help.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, candies, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Mahsat

texts.en:
Mahsat is 50 years old. She is married and the responsible mother of two children. 

She is a fresh business woman. Mahsat six months ago began her business with animal husbandry. She also has land where she grows cattle feed. Mahsat is the only provider for her children because her husband has no job. Mahsat now is going to increase the working capital of her new business and in this way maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 1000 TJS to buy cattle for increasing the working capital of her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing the working capital of her new business

loans.name: 13 Ninh Phú Đa Lộc Group

texts.en:
Nương is 44 years old and she is married with three children.  She works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Nương has been involved in this business for 6 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is applying for a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future. 

She is the group leader of the 13 Ninh Phú, Đa Lộc solidarity group, which consists of three members.  This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. In the future, Nương hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Margie
