texts.en:
Margie is a funny woman who is engaged in the retailing business. Margie is 46 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a driver for an agricultural company. Their income serves as their children's allowances for going to school; some of the children are in college and some at the elementary level of education. The children's finishing their college and becoming professionals someday is Margie’s greatest dream in her life.

Margie brings out the best in managing her business and always encourages more customers and increases her profits as well. Margie wants to borrow PHP 11,000 to buy grocery items to sell. She strongly believes that by borrowing the loan she will encourage more customers and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: 08 Minh Hợp, Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Lan is 38 years old and she is married with two children. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for seven years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

She  is the group leader of the 08 Mnh Hợp, Minh Lộc solidarity group, which consists of four members.  This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. In the future, she hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: 04 Hưng Bắc Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Hoa is 19 years old and she is married with no children. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for seven years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

She  is the group leader of the 04 Hưng Bắc Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of eight members. This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, she  hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Coop Cocurimu G2 2014B Group

texts.en:
Angelique is 34 years old. She is married with four children. She has been in the rice production for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to buy more wetlands for cultivation so that she gets more rice output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Suyapa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Todos los días Suyapa, de 46 años, se levanta temprano para iniciar su jornada laboral. Diario prepara distintos bolsos donde guarda su mercadería: zapatos, ropa, carteras u otros objetos que le sirven para sustentar los gastos de su familia. Desde hace 8 años, decidió, junto con un grupo de amigas, más el apoyo de su esposo y sus hermanas, vender mercadería en los alrededores de su casa. Hasta que un día se independizó y le compartió la idea a sus amigas para que cada una tuviera sus propios ingresos.   
Suyapa sueña con ofrecerle lo mejor a sus hijos de 5 y 10 años, por lo que todo el tiempo se mantiene activa en su negocio y por la misma razón desea incrementar sus ganancias. Para esto, es que solicita un financiamiento de KIVA y MICREDITO para comprar ropa, zapatos, adornos, gorras y otros productos que usualmente vende. Pues quiere aumentar su mercadería para poder convertirse en una empresaria completa que pueda establecer su propia tienda donde pueda exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Every day, Suyapa, 46, gets up early to start her work day.  She puts together various bags of merchandise: shoes, clothing, wallets, and other products to sell to support her family.  Eight years ago, with support from her husband and sister, she decided to sell merchandise in the vicinity of her house. Once she became independent she shared the idea with her girlfriends so each one could have her own income.  

Suyapa dreams of giving the best to her children, ages 5 and 10, so she always keeps active in her business and wants to increase profits.  She's seeking a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito to buy shoes, clothing, accessories, hats, and other items she typically sells.  She wants to get more merchandise so she can become the total businesswoman who can open her own store where she can display her products.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, accessories, hats, and other products.

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es: La actividad principal y de mayor importancia en Nicaragua es la agricultura. Actividad que se ha enseñado de generación en generación así como los hicieron los padres de Don Leopoldo que se ha dedicado a la agricultura hace ya muchos años. Gracias a un primer crédito otorgado en KIVA-MICREDITO logro sacar la cosecha de su producción de maíz, trigo y frijoles y cancelar el pago de las personas que le ayudan a la producción. Él solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de semillas de maíz, frijoles y trigo; de igual forma abono orgánico para tener una producción de gran calidad. Sus planes a futuro son seguir cosechados productos de calidad orgánica ya que son los mas demandados en el mercado.
texts.en: Agriculture is the principal and most important activity in Nicaragua, It is an activity that has been taught from generation to generation, just as was done by the parents of Don Leopoldo, who has worked in agriculture for many years. Thanks to the first loan granted to him by Kiva- MiCredito, he accomplished the harvesting of his production of corn, wheat, and beans and paid the people who helped him with the production. He is applying for a new loan to buy seeds for corn, beans, and wheat, as well as organic compost, in order to have a production of good quality. His plans for the future are to continue harvesting quality organic products, since they are the most demanded in the market.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, and wheat seeds, as well as organic compost

loans.name: 35 Minh Thọ, Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Khanh is 41 years old and she is married with four children. She has a retail business selling dry food and general items.  She has been involved in this business for seven years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.  Khanh is applying for a loan to purchase dry food and general items to resell. 

She is the group leader of the 35 Minh Thọ Minh Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. This is Khanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. In the future, Khanh hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase dry food and general items to resell

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Todas las mañana y en cada una de las casas nicaragüenses el olor más perfumante en el ambiente es el un rico y fresco café orgánico recién cortado y procesado de forma artesanal. Café cosechado por Don Sergio, un señor de 43 años de edad que desde muy joven se ha dedicado la producción de un rico y sabroso café orgánico, de igual forma también se dedica a la producción de tomate. En la actualidad Don Sergio Solicita un crédito para la compra de abono 100% orgánico para aplicárselo a sus cosechas y sean de excelente calidad. Sus principales planes a futuros son de adquirir más terrenos para una mayor producción y lograr sacar adelante a toda su familia.
texts.en: Every morning and in each one of the Nicaraguan houses, the most fragrant smell in the air is the rich and fresh organic coffee that has been recently harvested and processed in artisanal form. Such coffee is harvested by Don Sergio, a man of 43, who has worked in the production of rich and flavorful organic coffee since he was very young, just as he also produces tomatoes. Don Sergio is now applying for a loan to purchase 100% organic compost to apply it to his crops, so that they will be of excellent quality. His principal plans for the future are to acquire more land for greater production and to raise his family.

loans.use: to buy 100% organic compost

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela de 63 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora, quien ha criado a sus 6 hijos con mucho esfuerzo, ahora ellos ya son mayores de edad y han formado su propia familia. Ella vive con su esposo y sus dos nietas quienes son menores de edad, y estudian educación parvularia a 3 cuadras de su casa. Su esposo trabaja fuertemente en la agricultura y ella le apoya.

Adela es ama de casa, y a pesar de su edad ella presta sus servicios como ayudante en oficios domésticos, para generar algunos ingresos en el hogar, así también sale a vender pan y tamales a las casas del mismo caserío. Pero de la actividad que sobreviven es de la agricultura, ya que es de donde cosechan maíz, frijol y maicillo, los cuales son los granos básicos que se consumen a diario.

Con el préstamo se le estará ayudando a que pueda comenzar a invertir en la preparación de suelo para la siembra de maíz, como semilla de maíz, abono, fertilizantes, pago de mano de obra.

En un futuro quiere tener una casa más amplia, donde pueda establecer un negocio, del cual pueda obtener ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar, y apoyar con mano de obra a su esposo en las actividades agrícolas, ya que tiene avanzada edad, y los trabajos agrícolas son duros.
texts.en:
Adela is 63 years old. She is a hard-working woman who has raised 6 children with great effort. Now they are adults and have formed their own families. She lives with her husband and their two granddaughters, who are minors and go to preschool three blocks from their house. Her husband works hard in agriculture, and she helps him.

Adela is a housewife, and is spite of her age, she offers her services as an assistant in domestic work in order to generate some income in the household. She also goes out to sell bread and tamales to the houses in the same village. But the activity that they survive on is agriculture, since it is where they harvest corn, beans, and sorghum, which are the basic foods that they consume daily.

The loan will help her so that she can begin to invest in the preparation of the land for the planting of corn, by buying seeds for corn, compost, and fertilizer and paying for labor.

In the future she wants to have a bigger house where she can set up a business from which she can obtain income to cover the household expenses and help her husband with labor for the agricultural work, since he is old and the agricultural work is hard.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, compost, and fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Yulduz

texts.ru: Юлдуз 42 года. У нее с мужем только двое детей. Сын работает в России, а дочь работает на местном заводе по производству вафель. Юлдуз и ее муж занимаются дехканством. На протяжении 6 лет они выращивают овощи для продажи. В данный момент Юлдуз и ее муж активно готовятся к посевам. Они уже подготовили почву, однако чтобы завершить посев им не хватает собственных средств. Юлдуз решила взять кредит. За счет суммы кредита они хотят приобрести семена овощей. Этот кредит им очень важен.
texts.en: Yulduz is 42.  She and her husband have only two children.  Her son works in Russia, while her daughter works in a local waffle factory.  Yulduz and her husband are dekhan farmers.  For 6 years, they've been growing and selling vegetables from their farm.  Yulduz and her husband are currently preparing for the upcoming planting season.  They've already prepared the soil for planting, but they don't have enough money to buy seeds.  To this end, Yulduz has decided to take out a loan to buy vegetable seeds.  This loan is crucial to her and her family.

loans.use: buy vegetable seeds for the upcoming planting season

loans.name: 06 Vạn Thắng Đa Lộc Group

texts.en:
Trông is 48 years old, married, and has two children. She is the group leader of the 06 Vạn Thắng Đa Lộc, which consists of four members. She works in agriculture farming and raising poultry and cattle, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her are illnesses.

Trông requested her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women, which she will use to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell. In the future, Trông hopes her children find good jobs and her family is healthy and happy. She also hopes to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
Shavkat is a kind man, married and the father of two children whose ages are 3 and 8 years old. One of the children is already in school.

He has been busy with servicing more than 8 years. He services as a master of repairing houses. Thanks to his good experience in this field, he has a lot of clients, but it brings in little income. It does not allow him to provide for the needs of his family and repair his house because his family house is in bad condition. This year he is going to repair his house with modern planning. 

This loan will help him buy building materials to build such as cement, and wood etc. for repairing his house. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, and wood etc. for repairing his house.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is 32-year-old widowed woman. She established a small grocery store three years ago to cover her daily expenses after her husband passed away.  Zeinab has nine years of experience in this domain and is working hard to develop it as much as she can.
In the beginning, she faced difficulties gaining customers’ trust, but today she is well known in her region and she is providing them with special offers that attract their attention.
This is Zeinab’s second loan as an Al Majmoua borrower. With her previous loan, she increased her business merchandise with special offer products. Her latest loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua will be invested in the same way since customers seek special products and attractive prices.
She hopes to expand her working place to attract more customers and diversify her products.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer beverages that are highly requested by her customers

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Thoa has a manufacturing business making rice vermicelli noodles.

Thoa is 38 years old and is married with two children.
Thoa supports her family with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Thoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thoa has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thoa has been involved in her business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a clean water system and sanitary latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Thoa hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: 19 Bắc Thọ Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Hạnh has a retail business selling electronics supplies. She is requesting a loan to purchase electrical and electronic devices to resell.

Hạnh is 27 years old and is married with one child.
Hạnh is the group leader of the 19 Bắc Thọ,Ngư Lộc solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

This is Hạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Hạnh has been involved in this business for two years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase electrical and electronic devices to resell.

loans.name: 02 Thắng Phúc Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Hiền has a business farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Hiền is 34 years old and is married with two children.
Hiền is the group leader of the 02 Thắng Phúc Ngư Lộc solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2013, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hiền has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hiền has been involved in this business for one year.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Margie dreams to expand her business and hopes that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
He would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for he will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him sustain his family's daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jose hopes that his business will last longer and dreams to have a better life.  He meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week.  At these meetings, he also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages etc.

loans.name: Coop Cocurimu G3 2014B Group

texts.en:
Sylvestre is 39 years old and the father of five children who all go to school. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to buy more wetlands for cultivation.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Mikayil

texts.en:
Mikayil is a 53-year-old refugee. He is married and has three sons. His wife is a housekeeper and the family lives in an IDP settlement. He has a small livestock business and he also earns money raising and selling hay to other farmers. He has been working in this field for 28 years and has good skills. His monthly income is AZN 210.
 
Hay is one of the most important parts of farming. People buy good-quality hay in order to keep high productivity of their cattle. Hay is used for livestock in case the climatic conditions do not allow the use of year-round, fresh fodder. Mikayil supplies good hay for many farms and people know him very well.
 
Mikayil needs to repair his farm in order to keep it in good condition for his cattles' productivity. He applied for an AZN 1,200 loan in order to buy good fertilizer and additional livestock, to increase his income. This is Mikayil's second loan and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy good fertilizer and additional livestock.

loans.name: Carlos  Alberto

texts.es: Carlos de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, y sus tres hijos, el se dedica desde hace 10 años a la reparación y venta de electrodomésticos, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de su trabajo y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Carlos esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos por mayor para seguir con su trabajo y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carlos is 53 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and their three children. He has made a living repairing and selling electrical appliances for the past 10 years. His business is located in his home, and he has many customers due to the quality of his work and good prices. With this work he is able to cover the costs of him home. Carlos is requesting a loan to buy parts in bulk to continue his work and to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy appliance parts in bulk

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Josefa ha puesto todo su empeño para salir adelante con su familia, su esposo labora como bombero en una gasolinera, y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene su negocio propio, compra quintales de frijoles y los vende a granel, este crédito lo quiere para comprar 7 quintales de Frijoles y frutas para venderlas. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic le ha brindado con este crédito.
texts.en: Josefa has worked very hard to get ahead with her family. Her husband works as a gas station attendant, and he supports her with the home expenses. She has her own business, she buys quintals [46 kg] of beans and sells them in bulk. With this loan, she wants to buy 7 quintals of beans and fruit to sell. She appreciates the support that Afodenic has given her with this loan.

loans.use: to buy beans and fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 28 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace varios años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de lunes a domingo y tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. La clienta está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su familia.
texts.en:
The client, age 28, lives with her husband and their two children.  She has had her beauty salon business in her home for several years.  She works Mondays through Sundays, and she has a lot of clientele because she does very good work.  With the income that she gets, she helps her husband to pay the household expenses.  

The client is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy products for her beauty salon.  She will buy things like shampoo, hair clips, scissors, and other things she needs.  This way she will be able to get better earnings that will help her family to have better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, hair clips, scissors, and other things.

loans.name: Maura Elvira

texts.es: Maura vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar desde hace varios año que se dedica a la venta de ropa su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia pero también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su casa,  ella quiere mejorar su vivienda pero con lo que ganan no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito y comprar los materiales  necesarios como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra, y así construir un muro en la parte de enfrente de su vivienda para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos sin ninguna preocupación.
texts.en:
Maura lives with her family in her own house.  She has been selling clothes for several years.  Her business is located at her house.  However, she also sells in an itinerant manner in the different neighborhoods that are close to her house.

She wants to improve her house.  However, they do not earn enough to be able to do so.  That is the reason she is requesting a loan.  She will use the loan to buy needed materials like bricks, cement, sand, iron, and to pay for labor.  This way she will build a wall in the front house of her house.  She will do this so that she and her family are able to live more comfortably without any worries.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Lilian Jazmin

texts.es:
Lilian de 22 años de edad, es una joven muy luchadora, ella se dedica a la venta de pollos aliñados, esto con el objetivo de apoyar económicamente en los gastos del hogar y sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, uno de ellos estudia educación básica, los dos más pequeños aun no tienen la edad. Lilian solo estudio hasta noveno grado, lo que le hace difícil conseguir empleo, pero esto no es motivo para que trabaje fuerte junto a su esposo, un joven que se dedica a trabajar como ayudante de albañil, un trabajo bastante pesado.

Lilian tiene aproximadamente once años de dedicarse a la venta de pollos, ya que desde que tenía 12 años apoyaba a su madre a vender en el mercado. Lilian también trabajaba como ayudante de oficios domésticos, hasta que decidió poner su propio negocio. 

Con el préstamo, se le estará ayudando a la clienta para que pueda comprar cierta cantidad de pollos ya que los compra vivos y lo venden aliñado. Pero por el momento, se le hace difícil conseguir el dinero para seguir trabajando.

En un futuro Lilian quiere tener una granja en donde pueda tener pollo de engorde y gallina ponedora, y así ahorrar para  tener su propia casa, ya que por el momento no viven en lo propio.
texts.en:
Lilian is a young, determined woman who is 22 years old. She sells seasoned chicken in order to financially support the costs of her home and to raise her three children, one of whom is in primary school, and the two youngest who are not yet old enough to go to school. Lilian only studied until ninth grade, which has made it hard for her to get a job. However she still works hard with her husband, a young man who works as an assistant mason: a pretty difficult job.

Lilian has sold chickens for about 11 years, because she has been helping her mother sell them in the market since she was 12 years old. Lilian also worked as an assistant housekeeper until she decided to start her own business.

With this loan you will be helping the client buy a certain amount of chickens, since she buys them live and sells them seasoned. Right now it is difficult for her to get the money to continue working.

In the future Lilian wants to have a farm where she can have chickens to fatten and laying hens, so she can save to have her own home, as she currently do not live in her own home.

loans.use: to buy live chickens.

loans.name: Ninh

texts.en:
Ninh is 60 years old, married, and has two children. She  lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province and works in farming, raising poultry and cattle, which she has been doing for 10 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Ninh is not having a clean water system and hygenic latrine. She is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women, which she will use to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet. With her business profit, Ninh hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her business to do well, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: Rafael de 52 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y frijol. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante varios años y es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad para con los demás, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarla a los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, Rafael solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, controles de plagas, etc. Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que él consigue el sustento para su familia.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rafael is 52 years old and works in agriculture planting corn and beans. He has made a living doing this for many years, and that is how he earns his daily bread. He is a hardworking and responsible man, well-known in the area for his large heart and friendliness with others. When the harvest is ready, he stores it in the silo that is shown in the photo. Then he goes out and sells the harvest in the different markets that are around his home.

Rafael is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral to invest in the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, pest controls, etc. What he most wants is for his harvest to be abundant and better than previous harvests because that is the way that he provides sustenance for his family. He trusts in God that with his help, Rafael's dedication and hard work will achieve his dream of improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, pest controls, etc.

loans.name: Daysi Verónica

texts.es:
Daysi de 36 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, quien se dedica al comercio, para sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, de los cuales uno estudia sexto grado, y el menor de ellos estudia parvularia, la niña aun no estudia ya que es la menor y no tiene la edad para ir a la escuela. Ella vive  cuidando a sus padres quienes son de avanzada edad.

Daysi se ha dedicado a prestar sus servicios como vendedora desde hace mucho tiempo, ya que desde los 14 años ella apoyaba a sus padres quienes tenían negocio en el mercado. Por el momento se dedica a comercializar teléfonos,  gas propano y accesorios de belleza.

Con el préstamo, ella pondrá una tienda de helados donde tendrá paletas, sorbetes y bebidas refrescantes, por el momento tiene poco de estos productos; por lo que quiere invertir pues las personas vecinas buscan mucho estos productos. Pero por el momento ella no cuenta con el capital para invertir en su negocio.

En un futuro quiere tener un negocio grande, donde pueda  tener muchos productos que la gente necesita a diario y así obtener ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos del estudio de sus hijos, quienes entre un par de años necesitaran una educación superior.
texts.en:
Daysi, 36, is an enterprising woman who is engaged in commerce. She raises her three children. One son is in the 6th grade and the younger son is in early childhood education. Her daughter does not attend school because she is not old enough yet.

She lives with her elderly parents and cares for them.
Daysi earns her living selling in the market which she has done for a long time since she began working at the age of 14, supporting her parents' business in the market. For the moment, she sells cell phones, propane gas, and beauty accessories. 

With the loan, she will begin an ice cream shop where she will sell ice cream, sorbets, and refreshing drinks. She currently has some of these products so she wants to invest as much as she can because her neighbors seek out these products. For now, she doesn't have the capital to invest in her business.
In the future, she wants to have a big business where she can have many products that people need. She wants a daily income to cover the education costs of her children who will need higher levels of education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream, sorbets, and refreshing beverages

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María de 31 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos  por quienes se esfuerza día con día para brindarles estudio y todo lo necesario para que salgan adelante y cuenten con un mejor futuro. Desde hace 10 años que María se dedica al oficio de corte y confección, tiempo en el cual ha ido adquiriendo mucha experiencia como también clientes fijos. Ella es una persona muy responsable, quien trabaja con mucho esmero por dar lo mejor de sí. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de materia prima como: telas, botones, hilos y agujas, para poder atender un pedido grande del que ya cuenta y no perder la oportunidad de obtener ganancias extras.
texts.en:
María is 31 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children. She works every day to provide them with schooling and all the things needed for them to get ahead and have a better future. For the last 10 years María has worked sewing. In this time she has gained a lot of experience and a lot of regular customers. She is a very responsible person who works with great care to give the best of herself.

María is requesting a loan to invest in her business, buying a large quantity of raw material such as fabric, buttons, thread and needles. Then she can handle a large order that she already has and not lose the opportunity to make some extra profit.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, thread and needles wholesale.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is 23-year-old single Palestinian refugee. He is the sole breadwinner of his family of four. For the past three years, Husein has been working as an accountant. He is also in his fourth year of university and is studying accounting. 

In addition to supporting his family, Husein has to pay for his university tuition. His limited income isn’t enough to cover all of his expenses. Therefore, Husein is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. He hopes to obtain a higher education so he can improve his business and generate more income to be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for his increasing university tuition

loans.name: Catalina Del Carmen

texts.es: Catalina de 48 años de edad desde hace muchos años se dedica a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva maíz y frijol, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, honrada y responsable. Habita junto a su  grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y sus tres hijos.  Junto a su esposo trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y darles mejores condiciones a las que ellos han tenido. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Con muchos deseos de superación se acerco a esta institución para solicitar un crédito ya que la temporada para la siembra comenzó y es necesario iniciar la siembra lo antes posible. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita el crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. para la siembra. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá acceder a una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Catalina is 48 years old and for many years now she has dedicated herself to the earth. With much dedication, she cultivates corn and beans, which permits her to provide her home's daily bread. Catalina is characterized as hard-working, honorable, and a responsible woman. She lives with her family, composed of her husband and their 3 children. Catalina works long and hard alongside her husband to advance her family and offer them better conditions of life than they have had. 

Catalina's thorough knowledge of agriculture is how she manages to provide for household needs. With a great desire to advance, Catalina came to this institution to solicit a loan, since planting time is approaching and it is necessary to begin sowing as soon as possible.

This is the reason Catalina is requesting this loan. They must invest in the purchase of needed agricultural inputs such as: seeds, manure, insecticides, fertilizers, plaguicides, etc., for the sowing.  Catalina has faith in God and in her work which, in this manner, will help them achieve an abundant harvest, thereby securing a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: buy seeds, manure, insecticides, fertilizers, plaguicides, etc. for her crops.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 28-year-old single man. He has been a barber for fourteen years. In 2006, he established his current shop, and he worked hard to develop it.
He has earned his customers’ trust and support and he has been able to increase his income and developed a living.

Ahmad used to work in the construction business and specialized in laying brick, but he discovered that being a barber is his chosen career and he worked hard to achieve his goal.

Today he requests a YOUTH loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua, to build a bedroom which he needs at home.

Most of Ahmad’s customers are his neighbors, friends and relatives who trust his talents and benefit from his provided services.
As for the future, Ahmad is planning to refresh his tool, and redecorate to attract new customers.

loans.use: to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman is a 29-year-old refugee. He is married, has a son, and lives with his family in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper and raises their child. Osman is a farmer and has raised livestock (cows) and sold hay for 5 years. He raises them and the sells milk and meat at the local bazaar. 

Cattle breeding is very popular in Azerbaijan because people have high demand for milk and meat. They like to drink milk every morning or when they feel ill, and use meat to prepare delicious national dishes. 

Osman’s income doesn’t cover his family’s demands. He applied for 1,200 AZN to buy additional cattle and build a stable for his cows. He plans to increase his income and provide his son with a good education and bright future because he loves his family very much.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and build a stable for his cows.

loans.name: Mt Meru Group

texts.en:
Mwasiti is in her mid-thirties and is single.  She has been running two projects, a food vendor and selling stationery.  She has been in business for five years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be Mwasiti's 14th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used previous loans to start the stationary business, increased on the food stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is doing great and appreciates Kiva's support of their group which has made the group smile.  She used the profit to start building her house and paying for household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy out of stock items for her stationery shop. She dreams of being a successful business woman.

Mwasiti will share this loan with her loan group "Mt Meru", comprised of  three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy out of stock items for her stationery shop.

loans.name: Carmen Alexander

texts.es:
Carmen de 25 años de edad, es un joven  muy trabajador, ya está acompañado; mientras él realiza trabajos lejos de su casa, su señora se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y de la educación de sus hijos, de sus dos hijos, solo el mayor está estudiando.

Carmen trabaja la tierra desde muy pequeño, su padre fue quien le enseño estas labores, cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz  y 3,500 de frijol. Al acompañarse tuvo que buscar otra fuente de ingreso, ya que creció la familia cuando vinieron los hijos, por ello se dedica también, a ayudarle a ganaderos de la zona, por jornal.

Utilizará el préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas (semilla, fertilizante, productos fitosanitarios), ya se está a las puertas de la época para cultivar (invierno), por ello precisa ir preparando el terreno y tener la semilla y los productos necesarios para darle el manejo adecuado a su cultivo.

Su principal sueño es poder trabajar con ganado (propio) en un futuro, ya que ve rentable el negocio de criar, engordar y luego vender el ganado. De esta manera tener garantizado el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 25 year old hardworking young man who is married. While he works away from home, his wife takes care of household chores and their children’s education. Of their two children, only the eldest is studying.

Carmen has worked the land from an early age, taught by his father. He farms 7,000 square meters of corn and 3,500 of bean. Upon getting married he had to find another source of income, as the family grew with the addition of their children. Therefore he also works helping ranchers in the area by day. 

He will use the loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies (seed, fertilizer, pesticides), as it is almost time to farm (Winter). Therefore, he needs to prepare the ground and have the seeds and products needed to be able to farm properly.

His main dream is to work with livestock (his own) in the future, since he thinks that breeding, fattening, and then selling the cattle is a profitable business. This way he would be guaranteed to be able to support his family.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies (seed, fertilizer, pesticides), as it is almost time to farm (Winter).

loans.name: Nyame Wo Tumi Group

texts.en:
Nyame wo tumi is a group composed of seven people. They  live in the same district and meet every week to repay the loan, save, and receive training. 

They sell footwear, fish, foodstuff, charcoal, car engines, spare parts, and lace. 

The featured borrower is named Agnes, She is first on the right in the photo. She is a 47-year-old married woman with a family. 

She request money to purchase plantains and cassava to resell. Her expenses include meeting her family's needs. Her works from 8:00 am to  5:00 pm. 

She has five years of experience in this business. For the future, she would like to benefit from micro finance institution loans and become a supplier of products for women in her commune.

loans.use: to purchase plantains and cassava to resell.

loans.name: Margin Gioconda

texts.es:
A los 16 años, Margin emprendió en un camino que muchos en su adolescencia no lo hacen, el cual es trabajar. Fue entonces cuando tuvo el apoyo de su madre y decidió establecerse como comerciante de su propia pulpería y venta de cosméticos de Avon, para poder aportar en los ingresos de su hogar. Ahora tiene 22 años y es madre soltera de dos hijos, a quienes desea verlos en un futuro con un título universitario. 
Es por esto que Margin solicita un financiamiento que ofrece KIVA Y MICREDITO para invertir en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, maíz, carne entre otros productos; de igual forma en cosméticos, y así incrementar sus ingresos y seguir aportando en los gastos de su familia. Su meta principal es seguir creciendo personal y profesionalmente. Al terminar de pagar este préstamo, solicitará otro, ya que considera que necesita invertir más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Margin, 16, embarked on a path that many in their teens do not which is work. That was when she had her mother’s support and decided to establish herself as a merchant of her own convenience store and of Avon cosmetics, to be able to contribute to the household income. Now she is 22 years old and is a single mother to two children, who she wants to see with a college degree in the future.  

This is why Margin is requesting a loan from Kiva and Micredito, to invest in the purchase of staple crops such as rice, beans, corn, meat and other products, as well as cosmetics. This way she can increase her income and continue contributing to paying household expenses. Her main goal is to continue growing personally and professionally. After she pays this loan, she will request another as she feels she needs to invest more in her business.

loans.use: to purchase staple crops such as rice, beans, corn, meat and other products, as well as cosmetics.

loans.name: Nihoyat

texts.en:
Nihoyat is 57-year-old married woman with an adult child. She is hardworking and has a great desire to get ahead. 

Nihoyat has been selling eggs for the last twenty years. She stores the eggs in her house. She acquires the eggs by making periodic trips to shopping centers in the city. Currently, her partner helps her purchase the eggs.  

Nihoyat is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni to increase her working capital, which will enable her to buy more eggs. This is Nihoyat's eleventh loan with IMON. She is grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more eggs

loans.name: Muhogo A Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is a mother of three children who attend school. She is married and in her early thirties. 

For the past seven years, she has sold spare parts for motorbikes, mini-buses and other big trucks. She works from 7:30am to 10:00pm daily and is able to make a very good profit each month.

This will be her 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She successfully repaid her previous loans that she used to open her current business and buy stock. Her shop has grown to the extent that she needs a larger space. She plans to build a larger shop and buy  more tires. 

Fatuma used her profit to cover part of her children's school fees, food expenses,  and shop expenses. She dreams of expanding her shop and selling wholesale. 

She will share this loan with her loan group" MUHOGO A" which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to restock her inventory of spare parts.

loans.name: Yaqoub

texts.en:
Yaqoub is a 27-year-old single man from the city of Jabalia. He lives with his family in a small simple house. 

Yaqoub is employed in a local firm and earns a fair income. He wants to improve himself and receive a BA degree. Yaquob is a student in a local university and studies Islamic Education. He wants to find a better job in the future and become a teacher. 

Yaqoub took a USD murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his university studies.  Yaqoub will be able to take online classes online when he is not working..

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university studies.

loans.name: Muhogo Two Group

texts.en:
Daniely is in his early 20s  and is single.  He has sold electronic money transfers since 2013.  He works from 7:00am to 9:00pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.  

This will be Daniely's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to recharge his units and has successfully repaid his loans.  He is happy with the loan.  He used the profit to cover household expenses. 

He will use this loan to buy telephone chargers and other accessories.  He dreams of improving his life.

Daniely will share this loan with his loan group "MUHOGO B" which has six members who hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy telephone accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new tablet for his university studies.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 20-year-old single man from the city of Jabalia. He lives with his family in a small simple house. Ahmad's father is employed in a local firm and earns a low income. 

Ahmad is a student in a local university and studies elementary education.   He wants to find a good job in the future so he can help his family with their expenses. 

Ahmad took a USD murabaha loan from FATEN to buy a new laptop for his studies. Ahmad will be able to do his homework and write reports more easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase milk containers.

loans.name: Madia's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement a été mise en place le 08 Décembre  2012 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Il regroupe en son sein des femmes animées d’un réel désire de développer des activités génératrices de revenu. Elles vivent dans le même village et entretiennent  de bons rapports de voisinage. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Madia (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 32 ans est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 01 garçon et 04 filles. Elle s’active dans la transformation des produits locaux plus particulièrement la pâte d’arachide. Elle achète l’arachide par sac fait le tri, le décorticage et la transformation pour la vente par seau de 5 et 20 kilos.

Pour ce nouveau prêt elle va acheter 05 sacs de 50 kilos d’arachide non décortiqué pour la transformation. 

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’assurer une meilleure prise en charge des besoins familiaux (habillement, santé, scolarité, nourriture).
texts.en:
Madia's Group was established on December 8, 2012. The group unites within it lively women with a genuine desire to develop income-generating activities. These women live in the same village and maintain good relations with their neighbors. Their main activity is small business.

Mrs. Madia (seated at far right with one hand raised [in the photo]) is the group's featured borrower. She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of five children - one boy and four girls. Her business is the processing of local goods, particularly ground nut paste. Mrs. Madia purchases ground nuts by the sack, sorts them, shells them, and processes them for sale in 5kg and 20kg pails.

For this new loan, Mrs. Madia will purchase five sacks, [each containing] 50kg of unshelled ground nuts for processing. The profits will allow her to better see to her family's expenses (clothing, health, education, and food).

loans.use: To purchase five sacks, [each containing] 50kg of unshelled ground nuts for processing.

loans.name: Rebeccah

texts.en:
Rebeccah is a 48 year old woman married to Julius and a mother of three adult children. She has run a motorcycle transport business for the last fifteen years in Narok town in Kenya. She also rears poultry as a secondary business. Her monthly income is approximately 30,000 KES.

Rebeccah learned about VisionFund Kenya from a staff member who works with the organization. She has been advanced her sixth loan of 100,000 KES after successfully paying off the previous ones. She will use the funds to service the motorcycles. The proceeds will be used to expand her business and add to her poultry numbers. She also hopes to acquire a taxi.

loans.use: to service her motorcycles.

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
Harun is a 22-year-old single man from Ndunyu Njeru.

He has operated a welding business for four years. He has applied for his second loan from Vision Fund Kenya to  buy welding equipment to add to his stock.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy welding machines.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 34-year-old single man from Nyandarua South.

David has run a barber shop for several years. He has applied for a loan of 80,000 KES to buy shaving equipment to use in his barber shop. 

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy shaving equipment.

loans.name: Edinah

texts.en:
Edinah is 40 years old, married, and blessed with two children that she supports. She has been running a retail shop for the last ten years getting a monthly income of 20,000 KES. With a loan of 45,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya, she plans to restock her shop with a variety of consumable products.

The anticipated profits will be put back into her business for expansion. Edinah's dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to restock her retail shop.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan de 41 años de edad, es un hombre que labora fuertemente en la agricultura, para cosechar los granos básicos, como lo son maíz, frijol y maicillo, los cuales son esenciales en la alimentación diaria de su familia, que está compuesta por su esposa, tres hijas y un hijo que son los que viven con él. Su hija mayor tiene 17 años de edad y está estudiando último año de bachillerato, a 4 kilómetros de su casa, mientras que sus otros hijos estudian a 4 cuadras de su casa.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo, ya que su padre lo llevo a los 12 años de edad para que trabajara junto a él. Juan también sabe el oficio de albañil, ya que asistió a muchas capacitaciones impartidas por el programa de FOMILENIO, aunque el trabajo no es estable, en muchas ocasiones le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.


Con el préstamo el cliente lograra comprar sus insumos agrícolas, como semillas, pesticidas, herbicidas para las plagas y pago de mano de obra.  Los que utilizara para sembrar y cosechar sus granos, con los cuales podrá subsistir su familia que es de escasos recursos económicos, ya que el trabajo de albañil es temporal.


Juan desea que sus hijas e hijo no abandonen sus estudios, como él lo hizo, desea que en un futuro sean personas muy bien formadas, para que puedan en un futuro lograr tener un empleo con el cual puedan valerse por sí mismos sin depender de alguien más.
texts.en:
Juan, 41, is a hardworking farmer, harvesting staple crops such as corn, beans and sorghum which are essential for his family’s daily nutrition. His family consists of his wife, three daughters and one son who all live with him. His eldest daughter is 17 years old and is in her last year of high school. The high school is located 4 kilometers from their house while the other children go to school 4 blocks away from home.

Juan has been a farmer for a long time as he worked with his father since he was 12 years old. Juan is also a bricklayer as he has attended many training sessions in the Fomilenio program. Although work isn't stable he is able to help with household expenses on many occasions.

With this loan he will purchase farming supplies such as seeds, pesticide, herbicide for pests and pay for manual labour. Those which will be used to plant and harvest grains, which the family, who is economically disadvantaged, can subsist on because bricklaying is seasonal work.

Juan wants his daughters and son not to abandon their studies like he did. He wants them to be educated so they can have a job in the future so they can fend for themselves without relying on someone else.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies such as seeds, pesticide, herbicide for pests and pay for manual labour.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 35-year-old woman. She has five children. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community to bear her household expenditures. She has five years of experience in this field. She has become famous in her locality and counts a good client list. 

Razia wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, oil, grains, and beverages, to meet the increasing demand in at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

She is in her third loan cycle, with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, oil, grains, and beverages.

loans.name: Al Tariq

texts.en:
Al Tariq lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He is a responsible father of three children. He owns an artificial jewelry shop which is the only source of income for the family. 

He wants to purchase a variety of jewelry for the shop that includes bangles, necklaces, rings, and bracelets. He has been running this business for the last 15 years. He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. That is the reason his number of regular clients increases day-by-day. So, he wants to expand his business. 

For this purpose, Al Tariq is in need of more raw materials for artificial jewelry-making. Therefore, he requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to purchase a variety of jewelry for the shop, that includes bangles, necklaces, rings, and bracelets. He is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for the business. 

Al Tariq is very pleased after taking this loan and he is thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for jewelry-making.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is a 51-year-old married mother of four children.  She has run a call center since 2011 and has twelve years of experience in this area. In addition to operating the call center services, Fadia sells mobile phones, accessories and prepaid cards.

Fadia is the sole breadwinner for four family members.  Their increasing needs force her to develop her business in order to earn a good income.

Fadia requests a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy an updated printer to provide new printing services,  newly released mobile phones, accessories, and prepaid cards.

Fadia is optimistic and works hard to diversify her products and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy an updated printer, newly released mobile phones, accessories, and prepaid cards.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 36-year-old married man.  He and his wife, Naipanoi, have six children.

For the last 11 years, he has farmed his own piece of land and earns a good income. Wheat does well in this area due to a good climate.

He learned about VisionFund Kenya through posters. This will be his second loan. He plans to buy farm inputs and hire machinery to prepare the land.  

With the profits from the loan, Simon will re-invest in his farm and plant wheat.

Simon's future dreams are to buy a bigger piece of land, plant more wheat for commercial farming, buy farm machinery and educate his children. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his goals.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation.

loans.name: Gulam Qamber

texts.en:
Gulam Qamber is 46-year-old energetic married man. He lives with his spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

For the past fifteen years, Gulam has been operating a business making shoeboxes. In the beginning, the business was not profitable but over time Gulam has been able to make it successful. Gulam purchases his raw materials, which include cornstarch glue, cardboard, and colorful ink and paper, from the market. He makes the shoeboxes and sells them to shopkeepers. Gulam is able to earn people's trust and his clients increase day by day.

Gulam wants to expand his business. Therefore, Gulam is requesting a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to buy more cardboard stock. He hopes that lenders will support him and that his loan will prove productive for his business. He is very impressed with the Kiva loan cycle system and is thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to buy cardboard to make shoeboxes

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is 46 years old, a married woman, and the mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Bashiran’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Bashiran has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Bashiran is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some spare parts for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Mukhtyar

texts.en:
Mukhtyar  is a 52-year-old married woman.  

She buys animals such as baby goats & calves at low prices, raises them, and then sells them  in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses. 

She contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Hanifan

texts.en:
Hanifan is a 47-year-old married woman with 6 six children. 

Her husband has run a beauty salon for many years.  He has built a regular list of customers and earns enough money to contribute to the family income. He needs to attract more customers. For this reason, Hanifan has applied for 60,000 PKR for her husband. It will help him to purchase good quality hair care and skin products, packs of combs, and scissors. 

She is confident that her husband’s business will move in a positive direction as a result of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase  hair care  and skin products, packs of combs, and scissors.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 31-year-old married woman and has run a small general store in her community for many years.  

She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough money to provide for her family. She requested a loan for 40,000 PKR to restock her store with rice, sugar and flour.  She buys from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to consistently meet the increased demands for her products. 

She wishes to utilize part of her revenue to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine lives in Gyumri town with her husband, father-in-law, and three-year-old son. 

Lusine is a hairdresser. She works at one of the local beauty salons as a part-time worker. After her work, she also provides hairdressing services from her house. Due to hard and tireless work, Lusine perfectly manages to gather income and help her husband to sustain their family. 

The requested loan will greatly help Lusine to pay for renovation of the workroom and hairdressing accessories needed to provide hairdressing services. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the workroom and hairdressing accessories needed to provide hairdressing services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to support her tomato plantings.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
From Nyandarua South, Hannah is 48 years old, married and supports three children who are in school. Hannah has an electrical shop that she has been running for many years.

Now requesting her third loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy assorted electrical goods to add to her stock, Hannah hopes to expand her business in the near future and improve the family's living standard.

loans.use: To buy assorted electrical goods

loans.name: Donald Lom Group

texts.en:
These five fun-loving and jolly women formed a group to uplift their financial and economic status, and called themselves “Donald Lom”. Lalhlimpui, shown with her hand raised, is the featured profile member. She is 26 years old and a mother of two daughters and a son. She lives in Churachandpur, one of the districts in Manipur, in the northeastern states of India.

As per Lalhlimpui, this would be the third loan taken from WSDS. With the help of the WSDS loan, her family’s economic status has been improved tremendously, and she has gained so much for the smooth running of her business. 

Prior to availing the loan from WSDS, she earned income by usually engaging herself as a daily-wage laborer by weaving wraparound skirts for others. The amount she was paid to weave was very little. Therefore, it was very difficult to manage the household and children’s expenses. However, after availing the loan from WSDS, she could afford to buy yarns and employ people for weaving, and also become a supplier to the distributors in the market.

The family cash flow has increased, and more household property has been added. Her husband also helps her in running the business. Lalhlimpui says that with the third loan, she wants to buy a weaving machine to replace hand weaving (traditional weaving), which will help in increasing the production and at the same time expand her business. 

She also wishes to buy a plot of land and build a house for the family. She thanked WSDS for the constant support and financial assistance rendered to her and to her group members. Likewise, the rest of the group members are also in the weaving business.

loans.use: to buy a weaving machine in order to generate more income and expand her weaving business.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 32-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo). Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market since he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Samina wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salt, grains, pulses, biscuits, and beverages. It will allow her to meet the demands of her customers, time after time. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her third loan cycle, with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, grains, pulses, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 21-year-old single man from Gaza City. He lives with his family in a small simple house. Ibrahim's brother works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. 

Ibrahim is a student at a local university where he studies Applied Sciences. He wants to find a good job in the future so that he can help his family with their expenses. 

He obtained a Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Ibrahim will be able to do his homework and easily write reports.

Ibrahim appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad is a 23-year-old single man from Gaza City. He lives with his family in a small simple house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. 

Iyad is a student at a local university where he studies information technology. He wants to find a good job in the future so that he can help his family with their expenses. 

He obtained a Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Iyad will be able to do his homework and easily write reports.
 
Iyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Maria Rosa Evelia

texts.es: Maria de 40 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y ha ganado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefieren porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un buen servicio; Maria es una mujer entregada a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, piensa trabajar con esfuerzo y constancia para no rendirse en el camino; dese realizar una nueva inversión que le permita aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, herramientas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía. Maria tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old and lives in a house she owns with her husband. She makes a living by growing corn and sorghum. She has been working in agriculture for many years and has earned valuable experience that allows her to obtain the best harvests. She has a lot of customers who prefer her because everything she sells is of the highest quality, at accessible prices and with good service.

Maria is a woman who is dedicated to her work and has a great desire to get ahead. She is always looking for opportunities that will enable her to be successful. She intends to work with effort and perseverance so as not to give up on the path. She wants to make a new investment that will allow her to increase her production. She is therefore asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc. and to improve the terrain shown in the photograph.

Maria has good payment references; she asserts that she will be able to pay off the debt. She also hopes that she will bring financial security to her home.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc. and to improve the terrain

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 20-year-old single man from Jabalia. He lives with his family in a small simple house. Raed's brother works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. 

Raed is a student at a local university where he studies Health Management. He wants to find a good job in the future so that he can help his family with their expenses. 

He obtained at Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Raed will be able to do his homework and easily write reports.

Raed appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a handworking lady who is 26 years old. She supports her school-aged siblings. 

She earns a living from running a beauty salon in the outskirts of Narok, Kenya. The business earns her an approximate income of 15,000 KES in a month. 

Josphine learned about VisionFund Kenya from a neighbor who is already a registered member. She has acquired her first loan of 20,000 KES which will help her acquire an asset for the salon. The proceeds will be used to support her school-aged siblings.

Josphine hopes to educate her siblings to higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to buy salon assets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to provide maintenance and support for her farm.

loans.name: Shahbana

texts.en:
Shahbana has successfully built her business, stitching clothes, with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough money to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Shahbana requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, Shahbana will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy candy, basic grains, oil, rice, sugar, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Shenaz

texts.en: Shenaz, age 35, is a married woman. For about five years she has done hand embroidery work. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to develop enough business to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her continue operating her business, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik lives in Kapan with her husband and two children. Hasmik's husband works at a local medical clinic. Hasmik herself runs a small store. She sells different flowers and accessories for funeral services there. She works hard to run her store in a sustainable way.

The requested loan will be a big support for Hasmik to purchase supplies to sell in her store. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for supplies to sell to customers

loans.name: Most Holy Heart Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of four members, and the featured borrower is Monica. She is 39 years old, married and a mother. She sells plantains at her residence. She has the help of her family in buying and selling the products she offers. She is requesting a loan to purchase the basic food item called plantain, which she will sell to customers.

The other members of the group are: Vida, who is 42 years old and sells panties through hawking; Comfort, who is 34 years old and sells secondhand clothing through hawking; and Janet, who is 31 years old and sells soft drinks at the market.

loans.use: to purchase plantains, which she will sell to customers.

loans.name: Gulbahar

texts.en:
Gulbahar is 55 years old and married, with a daughter and three sons. The members of her family are refugees and live in an IDP settlement. Her husband is a musician and performs at different holidays, weddings and parties. 

However, the main source of the family’s income is livestock. Gulbahar has been breeding cows and selling fodder for 24 years. She has good skills in this area and gets about 150AZN monthly. 

Gulbahar usually buys small cows, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and resells them for a profitable price to butchers. She also sells milk and yogurt to neighbors or at the local bazaar. Farmers buy fodder from Gulbahar because it’s good and fresh. Everybody knows that products from Gulbahar's farm are always fresh, high quality and tasty. 

Gulbahar plans to buy additional livestock and increase productivity and income. She applied for a 1,500AZN loan in order to supply good fertilizers for fodder and to buy two bulls. She wants to expand her small business and provide her children a good life.

loans.use: to supply good fertilizers for fodder and to buy two bulls.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk for many years. She has two buffaloes, which she uses for milk, selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Shazia has become famous for providing good quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Shazia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en: Saleem is a 56-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for four years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is the mother of three children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy rice, grains, candies and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, grains, candies and flour.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is 35 years old, a married woman and the mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Ghazala’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional condition. 

For this reason, Ghazala has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some spare auto parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Ghazala is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some spare auto parts.
